description: Обязанности: Работа с существующими клиентами компании: обработка запросов на поставку фармацевтических субстанций, проведение переговоров о цене и условиях, подготовка и заключение контрактов, организация поставок субстанций со склада компании или со склада производителя, контроль дебиторской задолженности; Сохранение клиентской базы и удержание клиентов, поддержание лояльности лиц, принимающих решения о закупке; Мотивация клиентов на закупку фармацевтических субстанций из портфеля компании, мониторинг пайплайна препаратов клиента и своевременное формирование предложения по включению субстанций в НД; Конкурентная разведка: активный мониторинг действий конкурентов, сбор информации о ценах, условиях работы. Коррекция тактики продаж в соответствии с действиями конкурентов; Привлечение новых клиентов из числа контрагентов конкурентов, а также поиск новых клиентов; Документирование своей работы в карточке клиента , мониторинг динамики его закупок.  Образование: Высшее (предпочтительно фармацевтическое, экономическое, химическое, техническое). Преимуществом является дополнительное образование в области техники продаж.  Требования: Опыт самостоятельных продаж фармацевтических субстанций более 2 лет, наличие наработанной клиентской базы. Коммуникабельность, ответственность, умение держать данные обещания, стрессоустойчивость, обучаемость, ориентированность на результат.

LaBrilliante est une société internationale de production de diamants de laboratoire. Nous sommes de jeunes professionnels présents sur le marché depuis 2014 aux États-Unis et en Europe.  Nous souhaitons développer des relations avec des clients en France et pour cela nous recherchons un responsable commercial B2B très motivé.  Responsabilités:  Développer la clientèle en recherchant de nouveaux clients en ligne et sur la base existante  Développer et entretenir des relations avec des clients B2B de France et du Canada  Présentez l'entreprise par téléphone, e-mail et face à face (communiquer avec des bijoutiers du monde entier)  Compétences:  Expérience de vente minimum 1 anné  Français niveau B2-C1 (l'anglais est un atout)  Désir d'en savoir plus sur l'industrie du diamant  La communication et l'organisation à un niveau supérieur sont très importantes  Nos avantages:  Éducation sur les diamants cultivés en laboratoire  Opportunité de se développer dans un secteur potentiel  Participation au salon aux Etats-Unis, à Hong Kong et en Europe  Nos conditions de travail :  Premier jour d'emploi légal  Salaire : 40 000 RUB (Fixe) + 27 000 RUB (KPI) + 15 % de commission (en devise étrangère) + bonus supplémentaires  Horaires de travail : 5/2 à partir de 14h00 à 22h00 (Printemps-Été), à partir de 15h00 à 23h00 (Automne hiver)

OVERALL PURPOSE OF THE ROLE The SDR is responsible for identifying and developing new opportunities for the Sales Directors/field sales to pursue. SDRs generate demand primarily via outbound prospecting into assigned accounts, territories or buying centers. In addition to tele, SDRs use a spectrum of tactics including email, social media and chat. In organizations with limited scale, SDRs also may have limited responsibilities to further qualify demand generated by marketing and scored using a marketing automation platform (MAP)  DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES ▲ Generate new demand (e.g. individual leads and/or buying groups) for the sales organization to pursue ▲ Qualify demand (e.g. individual leads and/ or buying groups) against established criteria before passing a lead to account directors/field sales as Sales Accepted Leads (SALs) or qualified demand units ▲ Discover, validate and reach out to additional personas typically involved in a buying decision to determine possible buying groups for delivery to field sales ▲ Nurture predetermined groups of prospects back from field or channel sales by using multiple touch tactics (e.g. telephone, email, social) ▲ As a secondary responsibility – where specified by the organization – process inbound demand using a range of tactics (e.g. telephone, email, social) ▲ Comply with all demand management– related service-level agreements ▲ Provide accurate weekly forecasts to marketing and sales on the volume of qualified demand expected to reach the SAL stage or qualified demand stage ▲ Track and manage prospecting, qualification and nurture activities in the company’s sales force automation (SFA) system ▲ Reach and have meaningful, productive conversations with individuals representing the buyer personas targeted by the organization  DIMENSIONS OF THE ROLE ▲ Organisational interlocks: Field Sales, Channel Sales, Pre-Sales, Field Marketing, Marketing Operations, Sales Operations, Product Marketing, Product Marketing ▲ Technologies Supporting the role: SalesForce, SalesLoft, LeadIQ, Lusha, Linkedin Sales Navigator, full Microsoft Office suite ▲ Success Metrics: Accepted & Converted Sales Accepted Leads (SALs), new opportunities & influenced opportunities ▲ KPIs: Number of appointments set, percentage of set appointments accepted by sales, percentage converted to opportunities) Opportunity value generated from demand passed, Revenue value achieved from demand passed, Call quality with target buyer personas and buying groups & activity levels (e.g. talk time, dial and connect volumes, emails sent, social engagement)  COMPETENCIES ▲ Bachelor's degree desired ▲ Three to five years of prospecting experience, depending on the complexity of the product/ solution being sold, as well as the level of prospect being called (e.g. IT buyer vs. CXO) ▲ B2B experience ▲ Familiarity with MAPs and CRM systems ▲ Experience in an industry with a significant volume of customer/prospect interaction  ADDITIONAL SKILLS, EXPERIENCE, LANGUAGES ▲ Strong verbal & written communication skills ▲ Fluent English ▲ Active listening to asses prospect needs & opportunities ▲ Ability to articulate a high-quality value proposition on every call ▲ Ability to perform prospect & account research to prepare for calls ▲ Ability to use existing and emerging social media tools to monitor targeted accounts and buying groups, and identify trigger events for follow-up ▲ Discipline and energy to maintain high activity volumes (e.g. a minimum of 30 outbound calls and 25 additional outbound touches per day) ▲ A desire for a career in tech sales and ambition to progress ▲ Speaking another language other than English would be brilliant, but not essential

Innovate to solve the world's most important challenges  The Senior Business Consultant proactively leads, manages and executes the disciplined sales process from start to finish pursuing $1-10M opportunities. They will establish strategic relationships and have a vision for developing a committed customer, anticipating customer needs and requirements ensuring that they are met every step of the way from sale to execution. The role will be expected to deliver profitable growth in the form of new customers and new opportunities; with results above the set quota in support of Annual Operating Plan  Key Responsibilities  We are looking for a passionate and driven Senior Business Consultant to be a key member of the sales team, using your sales experience and technical knowledge to provide customers with market leading smart building HVAC/ security solutions. The desire to achieve sales targets and ability to succeed in a fast-paced and highly matrixed environment is critical.  You will be able to demonstrate extensive knowledge of the customers’ business, strategic drivers, added value of Building Solutions solutions, financial requirements in order to discuss and leverage strategic business value in conversation at the highest levels of the organization. You will be able to identify key stakeholders and decision makers within the customer business. You have extensive knowledge on the way to the market by using installer, general contractor, advisors/planners etc. in the assigned region. You will also be able to collaborate internally with multiple functions across the organisation to ensure delivery of high quality customer propositions and have a structured approach, using a robust Management Operating System (MOS) to ensure all essential sales forecasting and reporting requirements are fulfilled on time.  The successful applicant will be an ambitious Sales Manager or Sales Account Manager looking to forge a career within an innovative global business. At Honeywell we want you to be courageous, think big and be the best you can.  YOU MUST HAVE  An experienced (5+ years) Senior Business Consultant with a track record of success in selling building solutions, preferably in the Electrical, Smart Building, Fire, Security or Heating sectors  Well-connected within the Construction and Supply sector with the ability to re-open doors immediately upon joining the business.  Extensive network at C-level with electrical and Mechanical installers or General contractors  Able to setup strategic partnership with parties that can act as sales multipliers  Validated experience prospecting for opportunities and proven previous customer acquisition experience  Intelligent and articulate with excellent presentation skills  Experience of using modern sales CRM systems  A confident communicator able to build mutually beneficial customer relationships  WE VALUE A proficient understanding of key sales principles and best practices Excellent team and communication skills An ability to take initiative and work with limited direction An ability to influence across a broader organization An ability to influence customers, while maintaining healthy relationships Significant experience in selling (industrial) products Deep technical expertise Understanding of the Honeywell value proposition as well as the competitive landscape Additional Information JOB ID: HRD139102 Category: Sales Location: Kievskaya Str., 7,Moscow,MOSCOW,121059,Russian Federation Exempt Business Services
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Financial Services

description: (6286)  Career Opportunities: Sales Representative (6286)  Requisition ID 6286 - Posted - Russia - Pharma - RU - Ekaterinburg - City (1)  Bausch Health Companies Inc. (NYSE/TSX: BHC)-это международная фармацевтическая компания, которая занимается разработкой, производством и продажей широкого спектра рецептурных,безрецептурных медицинских препаратов и медицинских изделий, в первую очередь в таких терапевтических областях как офтальмология, гастроэнтерология и дерматология. Мы выполняем свои обязательства, создавая инновационную компанию, нацеленную на развитие глобального здравоохранения. Каждый день продуктами Bausch Health пользуются более 150 миллионов человек по всему миру.  Компания насчитывает около 21 000 сотрудников, которые объединены миссией по улучшению жизни людей с помощью наших продуктов, которые производятся и продаются напрямую или через дистрибьютеров почти в 100 странах.  Обязанности: Продвижение продукции компании, проведение акций лояльности; Ежедневное посещение аптек, проведение презентаций препаратов компании; Организация и проведение фарм. кружков; Поддержание и расширение ассортиментной матрицы; Осуществление выкладки продукции на полках аптек и размещение рекламных материалов в соответствии со стандартами компании; Регулярная подготовка отчетов о проделанной работе. Требования: Медицинское или фармацевтическое образование; Опыт работы не менее 1-го года: медицинским или фарм. представителем, торговым представителем в FMCG ( работа с аптеками); Навыки проведения презентаций‚ переговоров; Готовность к разъездному характеру работы. Эта позиция может быть доступна для следующих местоположений: Челябинск  Все квалифицированные кандидаты получат право на трудоустройство независимо от расы, цвета кожи, религии, пола, сексуальной ориентации, гендерной идентичности, национального происхождения, инвалидности или наличия статуса ветерана Вооруженных Сил, защищенного законодательством страны.  Соискатели должны быть осведомлены о мошенничестве в отношении предложений о работе, совершаемом через Интернет и платформы социальных сетей.  Чтобы узнать больше, пожалуйста, прочитайте Заявление компании Bausch Health о мошенничестве с Предложением работы.  Bausch Health is an EEO/AA employer M/F/D/V.
industries: Pharmaceuticals

description: Procter & Gamble has one of the largest and strongest portfolios of trusted, quality brands, including Gillette, Pantene, Fairy, Head & Shoulders, Oral-B, and many others. We are the largest FMCG company, selling our products in 180 countries and having more than 99 000 employees worldwide!  Sales Team Support Coordinator is one of the key persons who makes all promotions and marketing activations happen in stores. S/he collaborates with the entire team, different departments internally & externally and reports directly to Sales Director.  This position is part of a Sales team at Procter & Gamble. You will need to provide your coworkers with administrative support and stewardship expertise. The job is wide in scope and will involve close partnership with other functions (departments).  Responsibilities Coordinate team work on promotion activities: collect data, align with team leader, and communicate to the client (retailer) Upload promo activities in P&G internal business systems (discounts, goods booking, displays) Ensure correct promo prices P&G-Client. Check prices in SAP, work with price discrepancies: reasoning and communication to distributor and the team Work with payments: calculate compensation, reflect agreed amounts in P&G system, consolidate data for payment, prepare supporting documents to follow internal procedures Prepare reports for Sales team (price monitoring, sell-out, stocks) Communicate with the client regarding promotions, leaflets, and payments Archive documents for audit (internal and external alignments) Support document flow (sign documents via internal system and in paper, send to the client) Support team with ad hoc tasks Compensation & Benefits Monthly salary starting from 80 000 RUR gross Medical, travel, and life insurance Monthly lunch & flexibility allowance (5 000 RUR gross) Possibility of enrollment in P&G International Stock Ownership Plan Qualifications  To be qualified for the role, you must have Any higher education degree Good command of English (Intermediate or higher level) Advanced MS Office skills (especially Excel) Nice to have Strong analytical skills Excellent organization & time management skills Team assistance experience Just so you know All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, marital status, citizenship, HIV/AIDS status or any other legally protected factor. No immigration sponsorship is available for this position. P&G is a leading global consumer goods company whose winning brands are built around the model of innovation. Whatever your passion is, we want to ignite your potential to become your very best self. We hold true to our purpose, values, and principles as we seek to make a difference in the world around us. You will engage in meaningful work that will touch the lives of others and have a real impact. Everything at P&G starts with understanding – understanding our consumers and our employees as we innovate to improve lives now and for generations to come.
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Consumer Goods, and Financial Services

description: BACKGROUND Established in 2013, HONOR is a leading global provider of smart devices: smartphones, laptops, wearables, and audio devices, etc. We are committed to becoming a global iconic tech brand and enabling a smart life across all scenarios and all channels, for all people. With a strategic focus on innovation, quality and service, HONOR is dedicated to developing technology that empowers people around the globe to go beyond through its R&D capabilities and forward-looking technology, as well as creating a new intelligent world for everyone with its portfolio of innovative products.  HONOR pioneered many industry-first technologies and possesses excellent R&D capabilities to support the development of its full portfolio of smartphones and other smart devices. Created amid the rise of the digital age, HONOR develops an ecosystem of innovative products, including smart home and office appliances, healthy lifestyle and entertainment products. Every HONOR smartphone is subject to strict quality controls and must pass over 400 product tests and over 20 global certification standards before launching. HONOR owns 3,000+ service centers and 43 call centers, providing premium and efficient services to customers in over 82 markets.  KEY RESPONSIBILITIES As a Junior Key Account Manager, you will develop business plans and sales strategies and execution with our retail key accounts, which will ensure Honor to reach their targets. You will be responsible for selling Honor Smartphones, Tablets, Laptops and Wearable’s products to Russia retailers. Developing business with Russian’s retailers on Honor products; Participation in long & midterm Federal Key Account strategy creation; Annual Business planning; Sell-out & Sell-in management; Matrix management; Operational workflow support; Transactional control.  PROFESSIONAL ATTRIBUTE The successful candidate will have strong command of the English language (Upper-Intermediate or above); strong communication, negotiation, presentation and analytical skills. It will be ideal if the candidate has more than 1 year’s relevant work experience in consumer electronics or FMCG industries. Also, higher education - a bachelor’s degree or above.  WHAT WE OFFER Working time: 5/2 since 9.30 a.m. to 18.00 p.m.; Location: Business center Krylatskiy Hills; Opportunity for professional growth and career development; Competitive salary; Mobile phone allowance, medical insurance, discounts on the Gym and learning of English language. Free drinks, fruits on Friday; Office library.
industries: Consumer Electronics and Consumer Goods

Value Network is a decentralized, open-sourced prediction market protocol and trading platform on Ethereum, QTUM, and Binance Smart Chain blockchains. It allows users to place p2p bets and eliminate the conflict of interests and any chances of fraud. Now we are developing rapidly. There is a team of professionals behind this work, which we are also evolving. Currently we are looking for a sales manager able to attract investments to the project and knowledgeable in cryptocurrency and finance.  Responsibilities: - Generate leads and cold calling prospective investors - Develop opportunities in target markets with support of marketing - Identify, map and actively prospect with new targeted investors - Establish and maintain an effective and constantly evolving network of contacts and stakeholders. - Work closely with crowdfunding and accelerators platforms from US - Professional CRM user, shaping the pipeline of investors - A well-designed Linkedin page as an advantage  Requirements: - Experience in IR (investor relations) - Blockchain and cryptocurrency enthusiast - experience in cold calls with clients base - CRM user experience (AMOcrm, Hubspot etc.) - business negotiations and financial ethics - business correspondence - fluent english  What we offer to the candidate: - work with the core team of Value Network - the ability to influence and improve the product - applying knowledge in the right direction and expanding it - Key staff will be incentivised with short-term options and commission of funds raised - fixed payment  If you want to join our team in this position, please, contact us +79035477735

Viber is looking for an experienced Sales Manager for our Business Messaging product! This individual will be responsible for the development and performance of sales activities for Business Messaging in the Central Eastern Europe and CIS markets. The sales person will be required to build and develop strong relationships with the customers, and become their go-to resource and primary point of contact.  The ideal candidate is a seasoned, results oriented, sales professional to join our team and help us increase awareness of the Viber products and deliver revenue targets!  Responsibilities: Conduct full sales cycle, from initial contact to deal closure Building/ bringing a new base of customers into the ecosystem Identify and develop new sales opportunities; expand and enhance existing opportunities to build and manage the pipeline. Analyzing data and trends in the region, and making informed recommendations to the sales team and managers. Develop relationships and work with potential and existing partners in the region. Meet with and sell directly to key clients Actively engage with both aggregators and enterprises in the local markets to increase the visibility of Viber Business Messages channel and drive revenue forward Upselling and cross selling of products Negotiate pricing and contracts. Deliver presentations and demos  Requirements: English proficiency both verbal and written (an additional language is a plus) Deep knowledge of the SMS & Mobile app industry as well as competitors' offerings. Extensive experience in B2B sales A strong affinity for sales and customer relationships Strong verbal and written communication skills Enthusiastic, highly motivated 'team player' with the ability to work independently Excellent interpersonal skills combined with strategic thinking Goal driven and self-motivated Ability to build positive relationships and influence Proactive and can-do attitude with prompt follow-through Resourcefulness, with attention to detail If you wish to be considered for this incredible opportunity within the Viber Family, please submit your CV written in English. Thank you.
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Online Media, and Internet

description: Qualifications Undergraduate or master’s degree or have 1 – 3 years of work experience after completing your undergraduate degree Outstanding record of academic achievement Demonstrated aptitude for analytics Proven record of leadership in a work setting and/or through extracurricular activities Exceptional analytical and quantitative problem-solving skills Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment Ability to work effectively with people at all levels in an organization Ability to communicate complex ideas effectively – both verbally and in writing – in English and the local office language(s) Willingness to travel What You'll Do  You’ll work in teams of typically 3 – 5 consultants, playing an active role in all aspects of the client engagement.  This includes gathering and analyzing information, formulating and testing hypotheses, and developing and communicating recommendations. You’ll also have the opportunity to present results to client management and implement recommendations in collaboration with client team members.  You’ll gain new skills and build on the strengths you bring to the firm. Business Analysts receive exceptional training as well as frequent coaching and mentoring from colleagues on their teams. This support includes a Partner from your local office or practice assigned to you to help guide your career as well as several weeks of formal training in your first two years as a Business Analyst. Additionally, you’ll receive guidance and support from your local office in the selection of client projects, helping you to develop your skills and build your network.  We view the Business Analyst position as the start of a rewarding, challenging, and highly flexible career with McKinsey. During your first few years with the firm, you will serve as a BA on multiple client engagements and work with a number of colleagues and clients in a range of industry and functional areas. We encourage you to explore different content areas or geographies through a year-long rotation with one of our practices (e.g., corporate finance, social sector, healthcare, operations) or global offices; many do this after two years as a generalist BA.  Following your BA tenure, assuming good performance, you will move into a post-graduate school role. Some BAs will take advantage of the opportunity to get outside experience through a secondment (externship) with a private sector or social sector client with the firm’s support. Others may choose to pursue graduate school with support from the firm.  Who You'll Work With  Business Analysts join our offices and practices (e.g. Digital, Marketing & Sales, Operations, etc.) around the world to work in teams and directly with our clients.  When you join McKinsey as a Business Analyst (BA), you are joining a firm that will challenge you and invest in your professional development. In this role you will work on the best teams to help the best organizations in the world – in private, public, and social sectors – solve their most difficult problems. You will also work with many experts, from data scientists and researchers to software and app designers.  If you are interested in joining a specific practice, please indicate this in your office/practice preference (combinations are possible). To learn more about how we help our clients and where you fit in, visit our careers site.
industries: Management Consulting

description: Join the Wingtra team and become part of this venture-backed robotics scale up with an international and diverse team of 100+ dedicated Wingtranauts, and growing. Founded at ETH Zurich more than 5 years ago, our high-performance WingtraOne drone is continuously improved by a world-class team of 30+ engineers. By now our customers have grown from survey and mapping professionals to scientists, humanitarian organizations and environmentalists. They fly WingtraOne more than a thousand hours on a monthly basis. And we believe this is only the beginning—together we can achieve so much more.  In this role, you will join the world’s leading professional VTOL drone company at a high-growth stage and take a key role in expanding our sales and business development activities across Russia and Eastern Europe. You will have the unique chance to work for the Top2 best startup in Switzerland and be part of our journey disrupting the geospatial, construction, mining and other industries. This role can be pursued remotely.  Responsibilities Manage a network of distribution partners across Russia and Eastern Europe Develop and execute sales strategies to expand Wingtra’s market share, working closely with key account managers Empower our partners by supporting them to generate B2B sales leads, conduct product demonstrations, close deals end-to-end You will generate new distribution partnership leads, negotiate distribution agreements, close deals with some of the largest accounts in the region Be a strong promoter of our product and brand on the target market Organize and travel to roadshows, customer meetups and tradeshows Learn about customer use cases and market opportunities and post-process customer learnings for Wingtra’s strategy development Organize regular video conferences with the HQ in Switzerland and regional partners Source new leads and maintain customer info in CRM tools (HubSpot) Requirements Proven experience (3+ years) in B2B channel sales management or equivalent business development experience Proven track record of delivering above expectations Experience in the drone industry, surveying, construction or equivalent Comfortable driving both large enterprise opportunities with long sales cycles and dynamically closing smaller faster-paced inbound opportunities Experience initiating and managing change within a partner’s business The ability to demonstrate a strong aptitude for both selling and building lasting relationships with distribution partners Strong business acumen and comfort with presenting to, and establishing relationships with, senior executives in enterprise-level companies Technologically savvy and ability to learn and demonstrate new technology fast Excellent interpersonal and communication skills. Fast learner and well structured Persuasive, independent, at ease negotiating and developing trust Willingness to travel frequently (up to 50%) Professional fluency in English, Russian and any other regional languages Plus Strong network in the geospatial / surveying / construction industry If you enjoy teamwork more than being the individual superhero, and if you thrive in a feedback-driven culture and an exciting, unconventional yet structured and progressive start-up environment, we would love to hear from you.

Responsibilities Contacting the existing customer base (OEM customers, engineering and trading companies, design organizations, large end users) WITHOUT cold calls, WITHOUT business trips Customer Technical support Sizing of equipment/selection of equipment Processing of incoming requests from customers, making commercial offers, offers follow up Attending special exhibitions, technical seminars and conferences Qualifications Technical education (mandatory) English language: At least entermediate level Responsibility, attentiveness, high level of self-organization and motivation  Conditions Salary based on the results of the interview, monthly bonuses Official salary, legal job according to the Labor Code of the Russian Federation from the first day Flexible schedule Corporate lunches Career development opportunites Office location: Moscow, Ryabinovaya str., 38B (m.Ozernaya, m. Yugo-zapadnaya, m. Kuntsevskaya, m. Molodezhnaya)

Overview  Bruker Corporation is one of the world`s leading manufacturer of analytical measurement systems for the life sciences. For more than 60 years, Bruker has pursued a single idea: to always provide the best technological solution for each analytical task. Today, worldwide more than 7.200 employees are working on this permanent challenge at over 70 locations on all continents.  The aim of the job is to develop the company`s business and to enforce Bruker Daltonics (BDAL) as a major, market-leading supplier for Life Science Mass Spectrometry (LSMS) solutions in Russian Federation and CIS countries.  The primary objectives of the job are to promote, drive and control the sales activities in a competitive way and in accordance with the company strategy, to raise the profile of the company in the Mass Spectrometry community and to ensure customer satisfaction and post-sale. Bruker Daltonics is searching for a Field Sales Representative to support LSMS sales in the Life Science and Applied markets in in Russian Federation and CIS countries.  Responsibilities Meets or exceeds assigned territory sales target by maintaining & growing sales in current accounts, and identifying & closing business in new accounts. Accurately forecasts prospects through the sales cycle. Maintains balance & list of prospects that reflects sales targets. Interprets customer needs & identify BDAL solutions. Builds & articulates BDAL value proposition. Understands customer decision making process, and key decision makers & influencers. Cultivates key accounts Provides technical and sales support to distributors Provides sales territory information, forecasts, reports and other business data through the BDAL management structure. Complete a business plan for the assigned territory detailing specific strategies and activities required to achieve goals. Identifies & works with internal resource to enhance customer interaction through sales process. Conducts marketing exercises such as direct marketing, conference participation, exhibitions, commercial seminars and composing advertisements Qualifications Bachelor`s or Master degree in chemistry/biochemistry or equivalent scientific degree Minimum of three years sales experience in related industry or experience in chromatography and mass-spectrometry required. Excellent communications skills needed to work with a wide variety of knowledge levels with customers of differing backgrounds, and withing BDAL Excellent presentation, interpersonal and organization skills Ability to work in a team environment with flexible working conditions Required languages: Russian (native), English (advanced language skills) Willing to travel within Russia and CIS republics To have a driving license To be able to use Microsoft Windows and MS Office programs
industries: Electrical/Electronic Manufacturing, Information Technology and Services, and Chemicals

description: Partnership with the Silicon Valley Investclub is designed for: Investors and family offices. Individuals looking to launch a corporate venture fund. Fund managers and investment bankers.  Responsibilities Monetize current relationships. Outreach and development of new relationships with asset managers, wealth management platforms, angel investors, and other clients. Leverage relationships to expand access into the right networks - be it investment communities, HNW individuals, angel groups, or family offices. Get creative and clever - whether in getting in front of the right people, tailoring opportunities for clients, or brainstorming a path forward on a potential deal. Regularly engage and meet with client base to demonstrate expertise and add value - provide insight into the market, deal flow information, structural elements of the market.  Interpersonal Skills Excellent communication (both written and verbal) and organization skills. Independent thinker and self-starter with the motivation to learn about and excel in a growing industry. Must be comfortable working both independently and in a team environment. Ability to multi-task and adaptable to changing and dynamic situations. Understanding of institutional equity research and sales.  Requirements Relentless commitment to client service above all else. Thorough, with very high attention to detail. Motivation and drive to build relationships. Organized and systematic with communication. Meticulous attention to client engagement and deal process.  Silicon Valley Investclub does not discriminate in employment based on color, race, religion, gender identity, national origin, political affiliation, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, genetic information, age, membership in an employee organization, parental status, military service, or other non-merit factors.

description: Описание компании  At BIC®, we bring simplicity and joy to everyday life. Our Human Expression, Blade Excellence and Flame for Life products create a sense of ease and delight in the millions of moments that make up the human experience. We reimagine everyday essentials that are present in over 4 million retail outlets in more than 160 countries around the world.  Our founder, Marcel Bich, understood that to succeed, we needed team members who dreamt big and created clever, simple, yet bold solutions. Today, we provide our more than 15,000 team members in 61 countries with the opportunity to build products that are high-quality, safe, affordable, essential and for everyone, everywhere. We are committed to our team members’ development and empower those who wish to discover different areas of our business or acquire international experiences.  Описание вакансии  As Territory Sales Manager, You Will Be Responsible For BIC sales development in local retailers and distributors across assigned region; Negotiations with local key accounts/distributors; Tracking and high-quality execution of agreements on regular and promo assortment with customers; Customers’ commercial indicators analysis and further business initiatives development and implementation; New SKUs listing and business development initiatives implementation for clients; Promo activities development and implementation in close collaboration with customers; Field staff training on BIC assortment and sales skills; Ensuring high-quality merchandising for customers. Требования к квалификации University degree; 2-3 years’ experience in FMCG sales; Not less than 2 years’ experience with Local Key Accounts (retailers and distributors); Deep knowledge of local retail chains and traditional trade specifics; Strong knowledge of marketing tools; Excellent knowledge of MS Excel and MS Power Point; Developed skills of sales execution and field staff training; Strong communication skills and drive for result. Дополнительная информация  BIC is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We strongly commit to hiring people with different backgrounds and experiences to help us build better products, make better decisions, and better serve our customers. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, veteran status, disability status, or similar characteristics. All employment is decided based on qualifications, merit, and business need.  BIC is not seeking assistance or accepting unsolicited resumes from search firms for this employment opportunity. Regardless of past practice, all resumes submitted by search firms to any team member at BIC via email, or directly to a BIC team member in any form without a valid written search agreement in place for that position will be deemed the sole property of BIC, and no fee will be paid in the event the candidate is hired by BIC as a result of the referral or through other means.
industries: Consumer Goods

description: The OSMETALL Group is an international steel distribution company with its headquarter situated in Ratingen, near Düsseldorf but is also holding branch offices in Istanbul, Barcelona and Moscow (with their Back Office in Samara).  The two main pillars of the company concentrate on the divisions Steel Pipes, Pipe Fittings, Flanges (summarily: Piping Solutions) and Forgings (summarily: Forging Solutions).  In order to completely serve and cover all the needs of their customers, OSMETALL have extended their service portfolio with Plates, Round bars and Fasteners in addition to their unique strengths in order to provide support with a “one-stop service” solution.  Our Standards:               DIN/EN · ISO · ASME · ASTM · API · GOST · BS Our Materials:                Unalloyed-Carbon-Steel · Low-Temperature-Steel Alloy-Carbon-Steel · Stainless-Steel · Duplex-Steel Super-Duplex-Steel · Nickelalloys  *Carbon Steel ASTM/ASME: SA106Gr.B/C, SA333Gr.6, SA335 P1+P5+P9+P11(12), P22+P91 DIN/EN: P235GH, P355NH/NL1, 16Mo3, 13CrMo45, 10CrMo9-10, X10CrMoVNb9-10  *Stainless Steel ASTM/ASME: 304, 304/L, 304H, 321, 321H, 316Ti, 316H, 347H, 904L DIN/EN: 1.4301, 1.4306/1.4307, 1.4541, 1.4571, 1.4550, 1.4539  *Duplex & Super Duplex Steel ASTM/ASME: UNS S31803, UNS S32750 DIN/EN: 1.4462, 1.4410  *Nickel Alloy ASTM/ASME: Alloy 200,Alloy 400,Alloy 600/625,Alloy 825,Alloy 276,Alloy C22,Alloy 59 DIN/EN: 2.4066, 2.4360, 2.4816, 2.4856, 2.4858, 2.4819, 2.4602, 2.4605  Fittings ½“ - 24“ in seamless and welded Flanges ½“ – 60“ mainly in forged execution Forgings and hot rolled seamless Rings, all acc. drawings Pipes ½“ - 24“ in seamless and welded  What we are renowned for* OSMETALL stands out in particular for always delivering the perfect solution, no matter how challenging and complicated the task may be, for OSMETALL difficult is usually quite easy. Our strengths lies in the professional handling of:  Solutions for any kind of Restrictions:* Restriction of Origin: Western Europe, Europe-wide, G7 countries like USA, Canada, Japan or Worldwide Approved Manufacturer Limitation: Saudi Aramco®, Norsok®, GE®, Linde®, Repsol®, Petrobas® and others Approval Requirements: ISO 9001, PED 2014/68/EC, AD-2000, ASME U-Stamp, API Monogram, TÜV®, Marine like DNV®, LR®, ABS®  To strengten our branch in Russia, we are looking for an Sales Manager with working experience in the steel sector or in a steel trading company  Your responsibilities will be as follows:* Personal responsibility for soliciting orders for pipes and fittings made of steel and stainless steel Maintaining and expanding our Russian and Russian speaking client base through personal contact Tender preparation and tracking Contract and purchasing negotiations and contract auditing and verification of in-time delivery  What we offer:* International and cross-cultural working environment Interesting development opportunities and exciting projects Attractive salary package in line with your knowledge and experience  If you are interested in this position, please send your complete application stating the earliest date you could start and your desired salary to:  Andrei Ott - Head of Sales Russia Mail: andrei.ott@osmetall.com  Come grow with us and be part of a strong team.

Ref.  002530  Closing Date  18/10/2021  The Opportunity  Prestigious Defence Electronics Company specialising in Customer Support and Service Solutions (CS3) for military platforms seeks an experienced Sales Manager. The successful candidate will work as part of the wider Sales team leading campaign activity for specified opportunities with the aim of winning new business.  The successful candidate must be able to seek out, develop and close order intake opportunities for new business in UK and international markets. They will have a proven track record in Sales or Business Development, in the defence sector. Demonstrable experience of military operations is also preferable but not essential.  What you will do  Responsibilities include, but are not limited to Secure order intake to meet forecast targets for current and future years by managing a portfolio of key campaigns and opportunities Identify and create opportunities for future sales and growth Work closely with Bid Management to lead and coordinate all bid activity Develop and maintain relationships with Customers & End Users as well as Industrial Partners Develop and maintain relationships with key internal stakeholders including Regional and Divisional Marketing, the Capability function and other business areas Utilise internal company procedures to ensure that opportunities are identified, tracked and accurately reported to senior management Effective management and utilisation of the Business Winning budget by bidding for and managing the spending of funds required to prosecute campaigns Provide input and general support for communications events (exhibitions, demonstrations, conferences, etc) as required What we are looking for An in depth understanding of support, ideally through operational experience as an end user/operator or by having previous experience of support solutions to military equipment and platforms Demonstrable experience within the government public sector procurement and tendering processes Significant experience in developing, managing and leading key sales or strategic campaigns within the defence or other comparable sectors Ideally, will have worked in a global matrix organisation with complex reporting structures in an Integrated Project Team (IPT) Integrated Campaign Team (ICT) environment Demonstrable experience of contributing to the broader business agenda in regard to commercial decisions, operations and customer delivery within a Sales context Strong leadership and motivational skills Able to develop strong, trusting relationships at all levels within the business and externally and be able to influence effectively at a senior level Demonstrate a good level of emotional intelligence and be aware of impact on others working together during high pressure bid activity A capacity to overcome barriers and enact change Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written Self-starter and highly motivated and able to set short and long-term planning goals in line with campaign and business needs A task-oriented style, with focus on achieving clear and ambitious goals

description: Job Description Summary  Service Account Leader delivers financials on assigned account, develop and manage customer relationships and manage and develop business accounts.  Job Description  Service Account Leader is charged with the following employment duties:  Deliver for assigned account(s) Service Sales OP (Revenue and SM%); Deliver for assigned account(s) Service Sales OP by managing key process actions to make order executable to convert to a sale; Ensure minimal commercial leakage at the account(s) by controlling SM%; Identify and develop relationships with key strategic customers and accounts; Develop long-term relationships with assigned key accounts to generate business opportunities; Lead all large and strategic public and private customer relationship management activities  throughout the sales lifecycle with assigned accounts & ensure customer satisfaction & retention; Build relationships w/ with CXO level executives to define and implement GTM and strategic plan; Identify and capitalize on opportunities that immediately satisfy customer needs; Develop and maintain a high level of product knowledge of GE and competitive products; Develop and execute a structured strategic account plan and establish a process to engage customers and customer follow up procedures to drive growth; Manage the sales cycle  and all key account relationship management activities connected to the service sales cycle (cash, contract completion, etc); Integrate and coordinate with GEHC field teams to drive business offerings Negotiate and close deals; Negotiating and closing deals; Ensuring order fulfillment follow up; Supporting the Operations teams to address customer concerns and complaints and coordinating their resolution during project execution; Confident usage and utilization (reflecting sales/commercial activity) of CRM tools;  Minimum Requirements:  Higher education in Technical/Engineering field (as an advantage) Minimum 3 years of experience in medical, healthcare or technical field Strong communication and organizational skills Strong negotiation & closing skills Strong Presentation skills in front of the customers Business and results oriented Strong Project Management skills Ability to energize, develop and build rapport within the organization Ability to work independently/remotely English Upper Intermediate Confident use of MS Office.  Additional Information  Relocation Assistance Provided: No

description: Description  Russia based - The BDR is responsible for qualifying new opportunities for the sales and/or channel sales teams. BDRs telequalify marketing-generated leads (inbound), which is demonstrated by engagement with marketing campaigns, specific actions or meeting the scoring threshold set by a marketing automation platform (MAP). BDRs primarily handle inbound responses from assigned accounts and buying group members. BDRs should also be responsible for reaching out to other members of the buying group — individuals who have not yet scored fully (enquiries) — in a cold-calling effort to further qualify the potential opportunity associated with that group. In addition to calls, BDRs use a range of tactics including email, voicemail, direct mail, social media and chat to connect with prospects and foster a meaningful interaction. In organizations with limited scale, BDRs may also be responsible for identifying and developing additional demand via outbound teleprospecting or cold calling. Provide a brief, high-level overview of the position explaining the purpose of the job, strategic focus and what it is intended to achieve. Mention if the role has any Revenue/budget responsibilities, direct reports and size of team, if applicable.  Duties & Responsibilities Process inbound demand responses (e.g. inbound calls, chats, form fills) from buying groups that are generated, activated or nurtured by marketing, and qualify potential opportunities for the sales organization to pursue Use established criteria to qualify demand from buying groups for potential opportunities before passing it to inside reps, field reps or channel partners Discover, validate and reach out to additional personas typically involved in a buying decision to identify possible buying groups for field sales Nurture predetermined groups of prospects for field or channel sales by using multiple touch tactics (e.g. telephone, email, social) to foster meaningful interactions and determine the level of interest for potential opportunities As a secondary responsibility – where specified by the organization – prospect for demand using outbound cold calling plus a range of tactics (e.g. calls, voicemail, email, social) Comply with all demand-management related service-level agreements Provide weekly forecasts to marketing and sales on the volume of demand expected to reach the qualified demand stage Track and manage qualification and nurture activities in the company’s sales force automation (SFA) system Pursue meaningful and productive conversations with individuals representing the buyer personas targeted by the organization Dimensions Of The Role Organisational interlocks: Field Sales, Channel Sales, Pre-Sales, Field Marketing, Marketing Operations, Sales Operations, Product Marketing, Product Marketing Technologies Supporting the role: SalesForce, SalesLoft, LeadIQ, Lusha, Linkedin Sales Navigator, full Microsoft Office suite Success Metrics: Respond to MQLs within SLAs & ensure every qualified lead gets 7+ touches. Qualify leads to a high standard, set meetings for Sales & generate new pipeline for Blue Prism. Requirements  Competencies: Bachelor's degree desired One to five years of prospecting experience, depending on the complexity of the product/ solution being sold, as well as the level of prospect being called (e.g. IT buyer vs. CXO) B2B experience Additional Skills, Experience, Languages A naturally confident personality unafraid of calling people that may not be expecting a call A thick skin and the ability to handle rejections and not take them personally A natural tenacity and desire to win Being self-motivated and able to hit daily, weekly and monthly KPIs A desire for a career in tech sales and ambition to progress Speaking another language other than English would be brilliant, but not essential Familiarity with MAPs and CRM systems Experience in an industry with a significant volume of customer/prospect interaction Benefits  No one candidate will be a 100% perfect match to our description, so if you thrive in an intellectually-charged environment and have similar experience to what we are looking for, we encourage you to apply.  Blue Prism Software is an Equal Opportunity Employer that does not discriminate on the basis of actual or perceived race, creed, color, religion, alienage or national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, age, disability or handicap, sex, marital status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetics, arrest record or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local laws.  Blue Prism is not accepting unsolicited assistance from search firms for this employment opportunity. Please, no phone calls or emails. All resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at Blue Prism via-email, the Internet or in any form and/or method without a valid written search agreement in place for this position will be deemed the sole property of Blue Prism. No fee will be paid in the event the candidate is hired by Blue Prism as a result of the referral or through other means.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Financial Services

description: Suitable for: Account Executive or Account Director with experience of providing software or services to the NHS  Location: Homebased  Salary: Up to £70k + Car allowance  Please note that unfortunately, our client is unable to offer sponsorship  Our client is a successful software provider with nearly 25 years of experience dedicated to supporting health and social care in the UK. They have an immediate requirement for an Account Executive to join their Acute Unit Sales team and be responsible for managing New Business creation and account managing a number of territory based customer accounts, so that agreed annual business targets of revenue, profit and other associated objectives defined are achieved.  The successful candidate will have a direct impact on orders, revenue and profitability of the Company. The post holder will also be responsible for generating a high value pipeline for the future.  Experience/Attributes Min 5 years experience as Account Executive, Account Manager, Account Director or similar Min 5 years experience within market sector The NHS current market client base, including an overview of an understanding of the current market structure, the national Department of Health policy drivers, current issues and national targets set by the Health Minister and the business issues facing health organisations An understanding of relevant local strategic initiatives and future operational plans of organisations within the healthcare market Demonstrable success of winning business consistently within a pressurised, target-driven IT healthcare environment Clinical training will be a distinct advantage Skills Required  As Account Manager the following skills are essential: Advanced selling skills Advanced qualification skills Creative writing skills A high degree of self-motivation and drive Consistent use of CRM technology Full UK Driving Licence required Desirable A consultative style of selling able to identify values and solutions to client problems An ability to research and provide market intelligence information, setting up many different channels in order to assist with marketing and sales strategy tactics Strategic thinker Clinical background The Role  The role as an Account Manager is to plan and carry out direct sales activities, so as to maintain and develop our clients range of software tools to UK healthcare prospects and existing customers in accordance with agreed business plans. Responsible for the sale of solutions into the NHS, Private Healthcare and wider opportunities as determined. Duties involve identifying and closing both new and existing account opportunities  The role will include, but not be limited to the following: Lead the whole sales lifecycle process, including initial prospect engagement through to negotiation Protect and increase existing customer account revenues Plan/carry out/support local marketing activities to agreed budgets and timescales, and integrate personal sales efforts with other organised marketing activities, e.g., product launches, promotions, advertising, exhibitions and telemarketing Attend and present at external customer meetings and internal meetings with other company functions necessary to perform duties and aid business development Full Job Description Is Available On Request  To apply: Please follow the online application process and upload your CV, in Word format  Please note: You must be eligible to work in the UK for your application to be considered (sorry, our client is unable to offer sponsorship). Due to large numbers of applications, unfortunately we cannot provide detailed feedback to everyone, however, if you wish to find out how your application is progressing please call or e-mail the office and someone will help you / get back to you.  At Solo Search we take your data privacy seriously, by applying for this vacancy your data will be processed and likely stored on our secure internal systems. The lawful basis Solo Search use to process your data in regard to this application is legitimate interest and without further consent, your details will be stored for a maximum period of 12 months only. We will only ever use your data to assist you with your job search and this data will not be shared with any third party, including the client, without your explicit consent. Our full Data Privacy Policy can be viewed on our website.

description: JOB OBJECTIVE The Sales Development Specialist will implement training and assist with on-going evaluations of sales process, sales tools, and customer interactions. This individual will work with the Manager, Sales Development, by evolving strategies and improving systems that will result in enhanced customer support and strong relationships throughout the global organization. Train customer facing staff via in person, remote and asynchronous methods.  Essential Duties Develop and present sales trainings for a variety of audiences and programs (e.g. new sales staff trainings, product trainings, sales process trainings). Lead regional sales trainings that may require certification in specific techniques, e.g. SPIN. Work closely with sales teams and Manager, Sales Development to provide feedback to ensure sales training needs are being met. Proactively identify areas where managers could utilize coaching tools. Understand the use of and provide training on current sales tools (e.g. CRM, Power BI) and sales techniques/processes, such as Miller Heiman and SPIN Selling. Translate training concepts into practical and actionable sales activities. Collaborate with Scientific Training, SBU’s and Manager, Sales Development to enable the sales staff with sales content and sales skills when positioning new products. Demonstrate team skills by working cooperatively and collaboratively with others. Flexible in handling change and able to respectfully navigate a diverse set of business and cultural needs. Keep pace with sales and training trends and best practices. Bring new ideas to Sales Development team for consideration. Understand and comply with ethical, legal, and regulatory requirements applicable to our business. Incorporate Emotional and Social Intelligence principles into Promega’s sales processes. Occasional Duties Co-travel with sales field representatives. Coaching on training concepts during sales activities. Work with Manager, Sales Development to respond appropriately to requests from Branch Sales Managers. Create, review, and maintain training solutions in the Promega Learning Management System. Other duties as assigned. Mandatory Qualifications BS or BA (MS, or Ph.D. preferred) degree in a life sciences related discipline. 3 years sales or sales training experience. Proven ability to develop, grow and maintain strong relationships. Knowledge of Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook), e-mail and the use of the Internet. Clear and effective written, verbal and presentation skills. Has an approachable manner that encourages interaction with others. Proven experience in working cooperatively in a team environment. Ability to work independently and self-motivated. Preferred Qualifications Perform other duties as required. Previous experience giving oral presentations, teaching, or training others. Minimum 2 years previous experience with the Promega Field Sales organization. Physical Requirements Ability to use computers, tablets, and mobile devices for extended periods of time. Ability to travel up to 30% of time, including internationally. Diversity is important at Promega. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer, and make employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class.

description: Working Hours  Monday-Friday, 9am-5:30pm.  Duties And Responsibilities  Key Objectives Control and manage all aspects of sales related business to ensure retention and drive growth through annual sales targets Ensure that the business works in an efficient and effective way to enable it to deliver on customer demands both internally and externally. Functional Duties Shape and communicate the future direction of the designated accounts, ensuring all colleagues understand the business goal Generate excitement, enthusiasm and commitment to the achievement of business strategy and goals Lead by example Show commitment to driving business improvement, work to raise overall performance levels Persistent and reasonable A proactive can do attitude Motivational - understanding the effect they have on others Compliant with policies and procedures Able to challenge in a constructive manner Working with the finance team to ensure invoices are paid and on time Customer Focus Ensure as far as is possible that customer delivery exceeds expectations, and maintain customer relationship management Manage the relationship with all necessary levels of customer to achieve this To understand and challenge internal efficiencies, cost and challenge working practices that are not customer lead Strong understanding customer’s strategy and business Identifying new areas of opportunity and delivering business plans to support investment or strategic change for both existing and new business Agreeing and documenting an appropriate contact schedule for each assigned client account based on monthly, quarterly or bi-annual contact Writing account plans identifying new and additional areas for account revenue and growth Keeping the client informed of new products and services developed by Davies Acting as the main point of contact for all assigned accounts including: identifying and solving any account problems making sure any set-up or CR deadlines are met monitoring and reporting on the actual services used and volumes preparing account review packs and producing a contact report afterwards to be shared with the client and internal parties Planning and Organise Be proactive rather than reactive to resolve issues from arising Building knowledge of industry standard best practices and measures Building knowledge of the product itself and how we can deliver best practice Working with the Customer Service team, to ensure any helpdesk tickets raised are quickly resolved to the customer’s satisfaction Working with Commercial Director, to ensure current contracts and work orders are renewed on time Maintaining records of client details and account contacts in the appropriate database. Communication Keep Line Manager informed in a proactive manner through: Regular verbal communications Pre - set and shared objectives Written reports and monthly reviews Skills & Experience Required Good spoken and written communication skills Strong presentation and negotiation skills Confidence, tact and a persuasive manner Good organisational and time management skills We’re looking for confident, enthusiastic and results orientated individuals. Demonstrate an ability to negotiate and influence others both internally and externally Have a strong attention to detail and accuracy Have proven experience of stakeholder management and networking to achieve results Experience of working to targets and deadlines Experience of working in a proactive sales role either on the phone or face-to-face Who are Davies Group?  A specialist professional services and technology firm working in partnership with leading insurance, highly regulated and global businesses, with a global team of more than 4,000 professionals operating across the UK, Ireland, the US, Canada & Bermuda.  Diversity & Inclusion  Davies are committed to being a diverse and inclusive workplace, we welcome candidates of all genders, gender identity and expression, neurodiversity, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, body size, race, age, nationality and belief (or lack thereof).  Rewards and Recognition  We embrace innovation and run an annual competition available for all colleagues to submit their ideas. 2021’s top 10 finalists will travel to Nashville in Tennessee, USA where they will pitch their ideas to our investors, HGGC. The winner will receive funding to bring their idea to life, as well as rewards for the runners up, some of our colleagues have moved across into brand new positions to further develop their ideas/projects!  Other Benefits Include Premium Headspace membership - teaching mindfulness, meditation and wellbeing, for more information click here. Leadership, training & support for professional qualifications. Development programmes & institute memberships. Employee Assistance Programme. A number of discounts - short term car insurance, the Guardian newspaper, National Tyre & Autocentre and more Are you a Davies Person?  All Davies Group employees need to be able to demonstrate our Big IDEA; Inspire, Deliver, Empower and Aspire. It is essential all employees embed these behaviours in line with their job role.

description: Insider is a B2B SaaS company with a unique approach to multichannel experience orchestration. Recently, Insider announced its $32 Million Series C funding round by Sequoia. Insider was named the #1 leader on G2’s Mobile Marketing Software and Personalization Grids, with a 4.6/5 rating based 100% on user reviews, 19 quarters in a row. Insider was also named as the #1 Leader in the Forrester Wave for Cross-Channel Campaign Management (CCCM) with the highest overall score among all vendors, with a 5/5 rating in numerous criteria. CrunchBase recently ranked Insider’s co-founder and CEO Hande Cilingir as one of the top women CEOs outside the US.  Many of the most prestigious Fortune 500 companies and top brands in retail, automotive, and travel use Insider to deliver AI-backed personalized experiences that exceed customer expectations. Insider is trusted by over 800 global businesses, including UNIQLO, Singapore Airlines, Virgin, Toyota, New Balance, IKEA, Samsung, Newsweek, MediaMarkt, Nissan, AVIS, Marks & Spencer, Allianz, BBVA, Dominos, Avon, and CNN.  Good salespeople need two things. World-class innovative products and convenient commercials to cater to their prospects. Well, we offer world-leading products and a flexible commercial. These give us a starting point, but for most of us, that is just not enough. We like betting on ourselves to score the highest possible in this game, to climb the highest mountain, and to be the best there is. We are not only disrupting the tech ecosystem and democratizing the market but we are also disrupting the entire Saas sales community as well. All because we have a different style of sales. That's why we were able to expand so rapidly and we will never stop. If you want to know more about how not only to disrupt product & development but also disrupt B2B Saas sales, join us!  We want you to join us while we are taking a step into the future if you; have a university degree in Business, Marketing, or related fields, have previous experience with retail, e-commerce, and travel industries is a big plus! have a minimum of 2 years of Sales Management experience. Knowledge of Digital Marketing is a plus! can show us that “You’ve got what it takes!” to collaborate and build strong relationships with partners, especially at the executive level; remember, we don’t make a sale, we make a partner! have an extensive portfolio of Digital, SEO, and SEM agencies have proven oral and written communication abilities, with positive and energetic phone skills and exquisite listening skills; are a self-motivated, savvy tech bug, always in search of savvy solutions and ideas to improve our relationship with our partners; alas, we’ve got partners all over the world! cherish one of our core ethos: care. You’ll need to care for our partners and make sure they feel at home with our products and our around the clock support; have superior project and time management skills; have a keen eye for detail! Passion for testing, measuring, and improving outreach and follow up effectiveness; have the ability and flexibility to work in a fast-paced startup environment as well as high emotional intelligence. While we are conquering the world, we are offering you: a chance to work in an international, diverse, and inclusive environment; to be part of an industry that’s shaping the future of customer experiences; Don't believe us? Just ask Google. access and opportunity to gain a limitless network all over the globe access to many hard and soft skills pieces of training to help you improve and challenge yourself. access to our one of a kind training sessions on Sales; "Sales University" access to Udemy’s business plan, where you can choose over 10,000 courses to satisfy your hunger for knowledge; space to share your skills and even deliver pieces of training and workshops if you wish. Sharing is caring! the infamous team activities that are bursting with fun, no Dress Code! We provide equal opportunity in a zero-discrimination workplace and not just welcome but also embrace everyone without regard to sex, race, color, nationality, religion, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability status, citizenship, or marital status.  Please follow Insider on LinkedIn, Instagram, Youtube, Stack Overflow, and Medium!

description: Инженер по продажам сервисных услуг г. Санкт Петербург  Продажа сервисных услуг, запасных частей, оборудования, технических решений.  Расширение клиентской базы сервисной службы, заинтересованной в приобретении услуг сервисного обслуживания.  Предложение услуг сервисной службы, организация и проведение встреч, переговоров и презентаций услуг компании.  Обязанности Подготовка, согласование и передача коммерческого предложения, определение дополнительных потребностей клиентов (планируемые закупки нового оборудования, планируемые реконструкции и возведение новых объектов). Ведение процесса продаж в системе Sales Force или иной используемой компанией информационной системы. Заключение и оформление контрактов в соответствии с установленными правилами, составление карт заказов и других документов, оформляемых к контрактам. Планирование оказания услуг, в том числе по гарантии, силами как инженеров собственного офиса, так и с привлечением инженеров из других регионов. Организация своевременных заказов запасных частей и материалов в рамках заключенных контрактов на сервисные услуги. Требования Высшее инженерное образование. Успешный опыт продаж в инженерной сфере (от 2-х лет). Желательно в сфере вентиляция, кондиционирование, холод. Знание английского языка (разговорный уровень). Уверенный пользователь ПК. Отсутствие ограничений по командировкам. Условия: Оформление в соответствии с ТК РФ Заработная плата обсуждается с наиболее успешным кандидатом Место работы Певческий переулок 12, Санкт Петербург (м Горьковская) Job  Sales & Marketing  Primary Location  RU-Russian Federation-St Petersburg  Organization  Bldg Technologies & Solutions

description: At LeasePlan, we are always asking What's next in mobility.  Join our team and be part of a dynamic, exciting and engaging business, so we can discover What’s next together!  Position Objective The main objective of the New Business (Sales) Specialist is to source quality prospective customers for LeasePlan Russia (LPRU) and to convince them about the benefits which the operational leasing and fleet management services through LPRU can offer. To negotiate with prospects and convert them to a LPRU customer, ensuring that the customers best interests are served whilst maintaining an acceptable level of profit for LPRU. Primary Responsibilities To identify qualified prospects and appoint visits To visit prospects, present LPRU offer and its advantages, fill visit reports in internal system To identify clients needs and how they can be fulfilled by LPRU products/services and explain in order to obtain client’s acceptance To prepare actively, timely and accurate quotations and additional documentation (if required) taking into account the pricing, profitability criteria and process relevant documentation To negotiate master agreement provisions To regularly monitor and update the shared database of clients and potential clients To communicate with other company departments in order to satisfy the needs and requirements of the potential or existing clients To represent LPRU, it’s values and interests in front of the prospects and clients To qualitatively pass signed client to Account manager (meeting appointment, presenting account manager) To participate in company projects assigned by direct superior To prepare appropriate reporting Careers at LeasePlan  LeasePlan operates across more than 30 countries. With over 55 years’ experience, LeasePlan’s mission is to provide What’s next in mobility so our customers can focus on what’s next.  We also believe ‘you cannot grow a business; you can only grow people who can grow the business.’ LeasePlan is proud of its culture of service and care towards customers and each other, which has endured for over 55 years. By applying to work with LeasePlan, you are joining a team where you yourself will get to play a part in building the future of our business.
industries: Automotive

description: AsstrA-Associated Traffic AG - международная транспортно-логистическая группа компаний, основанная в 1993 году в Цюрихе (Швейцария).  Уже более 25 лет компания AsstrA оказывает комплексные транспортно-логистические услуги, соответствующие самым высоким мировым стандартам. AsstrA представлена в странах Европы, СНГ, Азии и США. Наша мультикультурная команда насчитывает свыше 1200 экспертов, ежедневно решающих логистические задачи Клиентов по всему миру.  Мы предлагаем Вам стать частью наших амбициозных планов и занять позицию Менеджера по продажам логистических услуг  Обязанности: Анализ рынка и формирование базы потенциальных клиентов; Активный поиск и привлечение новых клиентов, проведение телефонных переговоров и встреч; Работа с действующими клиентами с целью развития и продажи дополнительных услуг; Проведение переговоров на уровне первых лиц компаний; Заключение договоров, дополнительных соглашений, протоколов; Участие в тендерах Взаимодействие с портами Заказ контейнеров у линий Подготовка документов для таможни Требования: Опыт в продажах логистических услуг (контейнерные перевозки); Знание рынка внутрироссийских и международных перевозок; Навыки подготовки коммерческих предложений и презентаций; Навыки ведения переговоров; Собственная база клиентов как преимущество; Знание английского и китайского языка на уровне Intermediate Условия: Возможность дальнейшего профессионального и карьерного роста; Стабильная и своевременная оплата труда; Корпоративное обучение, участие в проектах и конкурсах; Оформление согласно ТК РФ с первого рабочего дня; Комфортабельный офис; Швейцарские каникулы для лучших сотрудников.

description: Компания Smith+Nephew, рассматривает кандидатов с опытом продаж как медицинского оборудования, так и медицинских представителей, имеющих опыт продвижения в госпитальном направлении, на позицию специалиста по продукции в направление Спортивная Медицина.   Обязанности:  выполнение плана продаж на выделенной территории консультирование врачей по техническим характеристикам используемого оборудования и расходных материалов проведение презентаций, демонстраций, воркшопов. ведение бизнеса с целью продаж на выделенной территории взаимодействие с врачами, медицинским персоналом и дистрибьюторами   Требования:  высшее образование, предпочтительнее высшее медицинское опыт работы в сфере продаж от 2-х лет, предпочтительно в госпитальном сегменте готовность к командировкам (до 40% рабочего времени) ответственность ориентированность на результат инициативность, проактивность высокие коммуникативные качества (общение с мед персоналом, грамотная устная и письменная речь) высокая степень самоорганизации умение работать в команде обучаемость английский язык Intermediate компьютерная грамотность MS Office: Outlook, Word, Excel, PP на уровне базового пользователя водительское удостоверение категории В   Условия:  оклад + квартальный бонус по результатам продаж корпоративный автомобиль добровольное медицинское страхование и страхование жизни и здоровья
