description: Location: Russia, Moscow  Goodyear Talent Acquisition Representative: Dina Gumirova  Customer Service Representative Russia  Principle Duties And Responsibilities Order entry: receive, place in SAP and process customer orders Inform the customer on the availability of products and the foreseen delivery dates of his orders. Offer guidance and support to the customer in all relevant ordering channels (through Customer Service or e-Ordering) Maximize sales and customer order fulfillment: take all necessary actions to align & sell the plan. Guide the customer through our product portfolio and offer alternatives where available Create deliveries based on customer orders: coordinate and release deliveries with Finance Dept, Invoice preparation Delivery planning: act as a liaison between the customer and Goodyear logistics execution to ensure orders are being shipped as per customer requirements. Claims resolution: manage Discrepancy claims (short/over delivered) and Pricing/Billing claims in accordance with customer distribution among the team and local process features. Specific reports PBUs related to Order Mgmt, daily and weekly. Reports to customers, ad hoc. Internal Contacts daily: Sales Force, Credit Control, Supply Execution, Logistic Execution, Demand Planning, Sales Admins, Pricing, Technical Support. Requirements  A 1-year work experience in Supply Chain/Customer Service  Knowledge in Excel  Effective communication skills  Accuracy in details and figures  Organizing and controllingDriving the results  Intermediate English  Goodyear is one of the world's largest tire companies. It employs about 63,000 people and manufactures its products in 47 facilities in 21 countries around the world. Its two Innovation Centers in Akron, Ohio, and Colmar-Berg, Luxembourg, strive to develop state-of-the-art products and services that set the technology and performance standard for the industry. For more information about Goodyear and its products, go to www.goodyear.com/corporate.
industries: Staffing and Recruiting, Human Resources, and Financial Services

description: Commercial Operations Representative  Would you like to take ownership of our customers needs to help them operate safely and efficiently?  Partner with the best  As a Commercial Operations Representative you will be providing a vital service by implementing, monitoring, and evaluating chemical delivery systems. You will take ownership of sites and ensure they have the service needed to operate in a safe and compliant manner while supporting our customer's needs.  As a Commercial Operations Representative, you will be responsible for:  Sales force effectiveness, productivity analysis, allocation of resources and territory coverage, sales incentives, Salesforce CRM platform and tools, lead for commercial planning and forecasting, Inquiry to Order (ITO) processes, ITO lead for business reviews. Cleans and maintains data in Commercial and other core systems (CRMs, SFDC, ERPs, etc.). Handles standardized products with pre-defined options requiring simple client advice. Contributes to Prices and conditions to have a certain degree of granularity. Works on the basis of predefined contracts price frameworks. Some latitude to deviate from prices and conditions. Handles diverse clients in a region. Cooperates with (technical) sales support to realize sales. Leads a department with medium-sized estimated orders. Handles local focus on Small-Medium size territory  Fuel your passion  To be successful in this role you will:  Strong oral and written communication skills. Strong interpersonal and leadership skills. Ability to influence others and lead small teams. Lead initiatives of moderate scope and impact. Ability to coordinate several projects simultaneously. Effective problem identification and solution skills. Proven analytical and organizational ability. Review tender documents to identify Clients' requirements, distribute documentation within the Company by responsible divisions and functions with a clear indication of requirements and time frames Preparation of draft proposal in XAİT or in the format specified by the client, and coordination of filling it out with all functions / departments Creation of a commercial model at Share Point for relevant PLs, correct filling of basic information and transfer to the sales department. Interaction with the sales department during the preparation of the Sales Model, with the aim of producing a proposal that best suits the client's expectations and Baker Hughes' goals. Preparation of the necessary documentation for submitting proposal including, but not limited to, financial statements for the required period, a copy of valid powers of attorney, cover letters, letters of guarantee, bank guarantees, etc. Weekly coordination of the project / tender with all involved functions and tracking the preparation of the tender / commercial proposal on time. Contract review, identification of risks, discussion of risks / mitigation plan with representatives of the product line and related functions. Filling in the risks in the Deal Machine (DM), with the receipt of the appropriate approvals. Integration of disagreements into a single Exception List with correct comments and justifications (with support of other functions). Participation in negotiations with the client, obtaining additional approvals upon request, according to the process, documentation of all approvals and updating the Protocol of Disagreements. Registration of won contracts in DM, according to the ITO to OTR process and their management. The specialist is ultimately responsible for the correct accounting of contracts in the SEAL system. Active participation in Commercial calls and preparation of presentations as required by ComOps Manager and Sales and Commercial Leader.  Work in a way that works for you  We recognize that everyone is different and that the way in which people want to work and deliver at their best is different for everyone too. In this role, we can offer the following flexible working patterns:  Working with us  Our people are at the heart of what we do at Baker Hughes. We know we are better when all of our people are developed, engaged and able to bring their whole authentic selves to work. We invest in the health and well-being of our workforce, train and reward talent and develop leaders at all levels to bring out the best in each other.  Working for you  Our inventions have revolutionized energy for over a century. But to keep going forward tomorrow, we know we have to push the boundaries today. We prioritize rewarding those who embrace change with a package that reflects how much we value their input. Join us, and you can expect:  Contemporary work-life balance policies and wellbeing activities Comprehensive private medical care options Safety net of life insurance and disability programs Tailored financial programs Additional elected or voluntary benefits  About Us  With operations in over 120 countries, we provide better solutions for our customers and richer opportunities for our people. As a leading partner to the energy industry, committed to achieving net-zero carbon emissions by 2050 and always looking for the right people to help us get there. People who are as passionate as we are about making energy safer, cleaner and more efficient.  Join Us  Are you seeking an opportunity to make a real difference in a company with a global reach and exciting services and clients? Come join us and grow with a team of people who will energize and inspire you!  About Us:  With operations in over 120 countries, we provide better solutions for our customers and richer opportunities for our people. As a leading partner to the energy industry, we’re committed to achieving net-zero carbon emissions by 2050 and we’re always looking for the right people to help us get there. People who are as passionate as we are about making energy safer, cleaner and more efficient.  Join Us:  Are you seeking an opportunity to make a real difference in a company that values innovation and progress? Join us and become part of a team of people who will challenge and inspire you! Let’s come together and take energy forward.  Baker Hughes Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.  R22404
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Oil & Energy

description: Salary And Benefits  Highly competitive salary, 25 days holiday, additional day off for your Birthday, company pension, dental plan, employee assistance programme plus other excellent benefits you’d expect from a leading global organisation  Our opportunity  Our National Bids & Presentations team are looking for a creative and organised coordinator to support the Bid Manager and Sales Team with the creation and coordinaton of bid and tender documents, presentations, sales tool kit and knowledge bank suite.  What You'll Be Doing  You’ll be working closely with nominated Bid Leads on day to day basis, coordinating all diary information on progress, completion of bids and their full content, plus any revision needed.  This is an exciting and fast paced role, giving you the opportunity to showcase your flare and creativity in creating effective presentations and propositions where no formal tender or bid  is required.  The work requires a keen eye for detail and exceptional organisational skills, to support the National Bids and Presentations Manager to implement strategy, embed processes, continuous process improvement and overall support for the Sales Team to help them generate and enhance content in the Business Development Knowledge. A toolkit will be provided with templates, slides and generic company information as well as having subject matter experts to guide you to enhance pre-written content  About You  It would be ideal if you have previous Bid or Marketing experience, but we’re just as keen to hear from Graduates looking for their first role Ability to build relationships at all levels, communicate effectively and build trust and influence stakeholders. Flexibility to travel on occasions, maintain confidentiality and work autonomously Excellent communication and organisational skills. A positive attitude and a proactive approach to solving problems. Willingness to support colleagues and peers and offer help Responsiveness to change and able to adapt Full MS office experience, particularly PowerPoint presentation experience at an intermediate to advanced level Due to the nature of our business, this role is subject to a satisfactory DBS check  Equal Opportunities  Crawford & Company actively supports Equal Opportunities and embraces Diversity and Inclusion
industries: Construction, Insurance, and Financial Services

description: Мы JTI, Japan Tobacco International, и мы верим в свободу выбора. Мы уверены, что именно она дает безграничные возможности. Последние 20 лет мы занимались инновациями, совершенствуя и создавая новые продукты, чтобы у наших потребителей всегда был выбор. И сегодня мы представлены в 130 странах мира.  Но JTI – это не просто бизнес. Мы – это наши сотрудники. Их талант. Их потенциал. Мы верим, когда они свободны быть собой, учиться и развиваться, то в нашем бизнесе происходят поразительные перемены.  Вот почему люди во всех уголках земного шара делают свой выбор – стать частью команды JTI, а 9 из 10 сотрудников рекомендуют нас своим друзьям. И именно поэтому уже шестой год подряд мы получаем статус Global Top Employer, как лучшего работодателя.  Так что если вы готовы к карьере мечты в компании, которую полюбите, смело присоединяйтесь к нам.  Узнать больше о нас jti.com  Ассистент отдела продаж, г. Санкт-Петербург  Подразделение Marketing and Sales  Офис Санкт-Петербург, Марата  Руководитель Дивизионный менеджер по продажам  Позиция постоянная  ЧЕМ ВАМ ПРЕДСТОИТ ЗАНИМАТЬСЯ Организация работы офисного пространства, Ведение баз данных, подготовка первичной аналитики; Осуществление административной поддержки работникам отдела продаж; Обработка входящей/исходящей корреспонденции Формирование отчетности по торговым и маркетинговым программам для руководителя и команды; Первичная финансовая отчетность; Помощь в проведении различного рода мероприятий Компании; ЧТО МЫ ОТ ВАС ОЖИДАЕМ Высшее образование; Ответственность, пунктуальность; Внимание к деталям при выполнении работы; Навыки работы на персональном компьютере на уровне «продвинутый пользователь» (Excel, Power Point); Умение работать в ситуациях многозадачности; Умение работать с большими объемами информации; Развитые навыки коммуникации; Знание этики делового общения; Знание английского языка на уровне Intermediate. Аналитический склад ума; Умение работать с большими объемами разнородной информации

description: Job Function  Sales  Why SoftwareONE?  Today SoftwareONE is a global leader in software and cloud portfolio management and is modernizing the way organizations budget and optimize their global IT spend from on-premises to the cloud. Our 5,000 technology experts located across 80+ countries work on over a 1,000 Technology Projects globally. We provide customers with the right advice on their Technology Roadmap towards the cloud or optimizing the Business-outcome of a cloud-based landscape. With our PyraCloud platform, applying machine learning, delivering the visibility, insight, automation and control customers demand to maximize their software investments. In tandem, our Software Lifecycle Management (SLM) services provide the methodology and framework to optimize the underlying IT infrastructure, accelerate cloud adoption and minimize compliance risk. With our dynamic leadership and driven business strategy SoftwareONE is one of the fastest growing technology solution providers in the world with elite partnerships with Microsoft, AWS, Adobe, IBM, VMware, Oracle, Citrix, Red Hat, Trend Micro and many more.  The role  Roles & Responsibilities Sales & Services Partners and co-owns sales activities at a customer level with the field-based account manager ( Business Development Manager [BDM] ). Performance and success measured by GP performance of region and individual accounts. Performance based quarterly incentives will be structured in commission format. Analyze & gather business requirement from large & complexity client environment and perform required research and investigation to identify and create thorough, accurate technical solution proposals based on client requirements. Responsible for partnering with BDMs and local sales leadership to drive net new business opportunities within the existing regional account base as well as supporting customer acquisition activities as assigned. Prepares cost estimates for licensing and product sales as well as professional services (deployment, migration, implementation, workshops, etc.) by studying blueprints, plans, and related customer documents; consulting with other engineers, architects, practice leads and other professional and technical personnel (both internal and external). Develop overall solutions including high-level design (e.g.-Whiteboarding), statements of work (SOW) and bills of materials (BOM) Contributes to sales engineering effectiveness by identifying short-term and long-range issues that must be addressed; providing information and commentary pertinent to deliberations; recommending options and courses of action; implementing directives. General Business Development, Marketing, & Partnerships Assist and own partnership/alliance functions to assigned partner relationships. This may include being primary contact for Partner/Channel Account Managers and assisting in GTM and business planning as well as driving forward programmatic initiatives. Develop relationships and act as liaison to local partners (VARs, publishers, distribution, etc.) to ensure available resources are being utilized where appropriate. Act as a technical evangelist for marketing activities including speaking/presenter engagements at conferences, conventions, user groups, webinars, etc. Partner with stakeholders and drive solution marketing activities by preparing and delivering content and messaging. Misc Maintain and report on regional service delivery, sales pipeline, and project status. Maintain and acquire advanced level technical certification in assigned area and m aintains professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops; reviewing professional publications; establishing personal networks; participating in professional societies.  What We Need To See From You  Success at SoftwareONE is not defined by what you do for yourself, but by what you deliver for our customers, the business and for the employees around you. SoftwareONE employees are energized, agile and are laser focused on delivering world class Customer Satisfaction and results. Our leaders motivate and inspire their teams and provide a working environment that delivers incredible levels of Employee Satisfaction. We are Humble, have a very high degree of Integrity and are simply not interested in politics. Our leaders operate with a high levels of Discipline but are able to work at Speed manage change in a global economy.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Financial Services

description: HENKEL IS FOR THOSE WHO STEP UP. DO YOU?  At Henkel, you can make a difference and craft your career. That’s why you own your projects and take full responsibility from an early stage. Our unique brands in markets around the world open up countless opportunities to follow your convictions and explore new paths. If you have an entrepreneurial mindset that allows you to always think out of the box - take the chance and shape the digital future together with us.  YOUR ROLE Support execution of workshops and user trainings for a sustainable maintenance of know how Monitor master data quality and consistency and coordinates required adaptations with the responsible functions Documents planning principles, guidelines and user manuals Support development of reports linked to Planning and Inventory Management Conduct adhoc analyses in Inventory Management and portfolio management Participate in integration testing and in end user testing Your Skills Higher degree Experience in supply chain, sales, customer service or logistic related area is a plus Microsoft Office user (especially Excel and PowerPoint). Knowledge of SAP would be an advantage English – Upper Intermediate+ Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities, proactivity, strong communication and presentation skills, ability to work as a team player

description: Insider is a B2B SaaS company with a unique approach to multichannel experience orchestration. Recently, Insider announced its $32 Million Series C funding round by Sequoia. Insider was named the #1 leader on G2’s Mobile Marketing Software and Personalization Grids, with a 4.6/5 rating based 100% on user reviews, 19 quarters in a row. Insider was also named as the #1 Leader in the Forrester Wave for Cross-Channel Campaign Management (CCCM) with the highest overall score among all vendors, with a 5/5 rating in numerous criteria. CrunchBase recently ranked Insider’s co-founder and CEO Hande Cilingir as one of the top women CEOs outside the US.  Many of the most prestigious Fortune 500 companies and top brands in retail, automotive, and travel use Insider to deliver AI-backed personalized experiences that exceed customer expectations. Insider is trusted by over 800 global businesses, including UNIQLO, Singapore Airlines, Virgin, Toyota, New Balance, IKEA, Samsung, Newsweek, MediaMarkt, Nissan, AVIS, Marks & Spencer, Allianz, BBVA, Dominos, Avon, and CNN.  We are the People & Culture Team. We are the enablers of people & the protectors of the culture. We respect & empower at every step. We like to see ourselves as the heart and soul-bringer of Insider and of our culture. We hire, we train and we retain. And as the Recruitment Team, we are the gatekeepers of Insider. We are the smiling bright face & wise decision-maker holding a great responsibility. Our aim is to find the A-players out there. The “Master-communicator” phrase doesn’t even begin to cover our people skills. We love what we do. That’s how we succeed in recruiting for numerous positions & functions in 5 continents & 25+ regions. You can either watch us conquer the world, or join us!  As a Talent Acquisition Specialist in Insider day in and day out you; will drive initiatives that nurture our company culture & create a charming journey for candidates, will successfully map the market for sales, partner success and leadership roles for Moscow-based roles will help recruit for HQ-based Russian speaking roles will effectively utilize HR tech stack of Insider to automate the recruitment processes, will develop and support employer branding activities & help us exceed borders & march with the best talent out there, will follow analytical approach to ensure the effectiveness of the hiring and retention strategies, will cooperate with the global hiring team and follow the trends to create HR best practices to stay up-to-date, will execute the recruitment strategy with operational excellence while optimizing the quality of new hires, time to hire and cost to hire, our aim is to become better with every day. We want you to join us while we are taking a step into the future if you: have a Bachelor’s Degree in related fields, have 2+ years of experience in SaaS/Tech/Digital recruitment , have excellent communication skills, we are speaking with the whole world, 5 continents & 25+ countries, are a confident, vibrant person with an everlasting go-getter attitude, have the ability to work and thrive in a fast paced environment, have such communication skills that speaking to people from different backgrounds, cultures & functions makes your day, have the ability to manage ambiguity, while fostering an example of professionalism and leadership, have proven ability to work in a fast-paced, results-oriented, team environment, have strong organization skills and the ability to prioritize multiple tasks While we are conquering the world, we are offering you: an opportunity to work in an international, diverse, and inclusive environment, a chance to be part of the expansion journey of a global start-up, access and opportunity to gain a limitless network all over the globe, “Keynote Sessions” with famous and groundbreaking people from the Start-up world and many events where groundbreaking ideas are discussed, Weekly sessions on best practices & personal development topics Free access to the essentials such as Laracast, Egghead, Udemy, Blinkist, Masterclass, Amazon Kindle, and Spotify, A chance to become a Shareowner with the "Shareowner System" that we offer to all Insiders who meet certain criteria, the infamous team activities that are bursting with fun, No Dress code! This is a fast and innovative startup, you can wear whatever you want We provide equal opportunity in a zero-discrimination workplace and not just welcome but also embrace everyone without regard to sex, race, color, nationality, religion, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability status, citizenship, or marital status.  Please follow Insider on LinkedIn, Instagram, Youtube, Stack Overflow, and Medium!
industries: Computer Software, Internet, and Retail

description: Main Responsibilities Implement the Global strategy for digital luxury execution and eBusiness acceleration through laprairie.com and e-Retailers. Identify local needs and requirements. Delivering the market Digital strategy, ensuring that all activities strongly contribute to the brand and business objectives while respecting guidelines and budget. Leading the Digital Transformation in our local subsidiary embracing from marketing and sales to the rest of the teams on this journey. Acting as key support to Communication and CRM Managers proposing and recommending on Digital Media and CRM recruitment / activation. Main Accountabilities  Laprairie.com Daily drive e-com revenue targets and manage day-to-day business levers to attract traffic, Provide an immersive shopping experience, Increase conversion and retention, ultimately driving sales and share of business of the luxury collections. Ensure the planning of the assortment and report the performance of promotions. Be responsible for maintaining all online operations and e-commerce functionalities, and continuously looking to improve and implement efficiencies by sharing insights and scope requirements with Regional Team. Provide weekly reports on agreed KPIs. Eretail Optimize visibility, traffic & conversion on e-retailers’ websites to deliver the best possible brand image & experience as well as maximize revenue. Collaborate hand in hand with e-retailers, make pro-active proposals of partnerships, experiences, etc. Digital media & CRM Support brand awareness objectives, customer acquisition, engagement, and revenue through internally driven and agency-led digital media investments Support local CRM manager on strategy, which should be locally integrated in the whole Digital & Media ecosystem, and in the implementation of best in class acquisition and retention activities Qualifications Degree in business/engineering or equivalent. Specialization in Digital Business or eCommerce valuable. Minimum 5 years of professional experience in digital and eBusiness both direct and indirect (e-retail) Strong track record in delivering successful eCommerce growth and Digital projects. Sound knowledge of current and best practices/technique/know-how in e-commerce industry. Pro-efficient with GA 360, SEO/SEM, paid media and social campaigns. Full understanding of key Digital KPIs, their inter-connected nature and what levers to drive performance and improvements. Experience working in cross-functional environment with a diverse stakeholder setting Language: Fluent in English.
industries: Staffing and Recruiting, Retail, and Luxury Goods & Jewelry

description: Company Description  At Infobip we dream big. We value creativity, persistence, and innovation, passionately believing that it is through teamwork that we can all reach greater heights. Since 2006, we have been innovating at the edge of technological possibilities and are now shaping global communications of the future. Through 60+ offices on six continents, Infobip’s platform is used by almost 70% of the population, making it the largest network of its kind and the only full-stack cloud communication platform (cPaaS) globally. Join us on our mission to create life-changing interactions between humans and online services with new and unseen solutions.  Job Description  Job responsibilities:  Pre-billing and Billing services for new and existing customers  Monitoring automatic billing and preforming manual billing with specific requirements (adding Purchase Orders, recalculations due to Tier Pricing, different billing models) Sending invoices and supporting documents to the clients Reconciliation (reconciling invoices with NDRs – network destination reports) Provide status on progress of activities Analyzing revenue leakages (non-invoice revenue, billing models, open offers) Analyzing pre-paid balance and coordinating with Finance teams Expertise on working on large data in Microsoft Excel with advance functions Coordinate with cross functional teams (Credit Risk, Internal Audit, Legal, Sales) for understanding the terms agreed with the customers at the time of acquisition & jointly addressing customer queries Calculating and billing late charge fees  Dunning and Collection Activities  Following internal dunning and collection procedures to ensure payment on, or before the due date as per customer agreements Improving company’s cash flows by actively preventing, managing, and decreasing bad debt provisions Continuous communication with the clients through over calls and emails to understand their concerns in terms of bill disputes, bill break-up summary & any other specific requirements of the customers for processing the payments Actively maintaining customer base and adapting to the Sales organization and segmentation of customer base In-debt knowledge of billing procedures, collection procedure and implementation and maintenance within her/his customer portfolio Actively managing doubtful debt and write-offs  Focus on Continuous Learning and Development  Participate in education sessions Be fully informed about new products and service and how to perform billing  Qualifications  3 years of professional experience Experience in customer care / account management would be a plus Bachelor's Degree English - upper-intermediate level or higher Exceptional professional communication skills Excellent command of MS Office suite, especially MS Excel Strong analytical and organisational skills, with a systematic approach to problems  Additional Information  Why our employees choose us (and stay)?  Awesome clients – We serve and partner with the majority of the leading mobile operators, OTTs, brands, banks, social networks, aggregators and many more. Seriously, our clients are really cool. Work with the world’s leading companies and impact how they communicate with their users! Opportunity knocks. Often. – Being a part of a growing company in a growing industry – we challenge you not to grow! Whether it’s horizontal, vertical, or angular, we want to support the path that you want to carve. Rubles & Sense of Wellness – Competitive salary, covered travel expenses, employer paid benefits, flexible work environment… Talk about a balanced lifestyle!
industries: Information Technology and Services and Computer Software

description: For 130 years Abbott is a global healthcare leader that helps people live more fully at all stages of life. Our portfolio of life-changing technologies spans the spectrum of healthcare, with leading businesses and products in diagnostics, minimally invasive medical devices, coronary stents, nutritionals and branded generic medicines. We help people with diabetes effectively manage it without painful finger pricks.  Abbott is one of the most diversified companies in healthcare. Our 109,000 colleagues serve people in more than 160 countries.  The key to successful treatment and full recovery is often fast, accurate diagnosis. Abbott’s life-changing tests and diagnostic tools provide insights that enable smarter, faster decisions and transform the way the world is managing health.  The Technical Support Specialist position is a key role in the service organization, providing both on-site and phone technical problem resolution for Abbott Diagnostics customers. In addition to technical problem resolution, the incumbent is responsible for developing customer relationships and building customer loyalty.  Key Success Factors Ability to manage resolution of complex technical customer issues. Ability to successfully prioritize and coordinate assigned field repairs in a timely manner. Ability to integrate, engage and collaborate within cross-functional teams. Demonstrated ability to balance between technical skills and customer interfacing skills. The Technical Support Specialist collaborates with cross-functional teams, including Technical Applications Specialist, Sales, as well as Global Service teams to achieve business and customer goals. Requirements Bachelor’s degree in engineering, life sciences or related technical discipline. (preferably with Intern experience in the field of study) From 2 years’ experience with troubleshooting and instrument repair and maintenance (preferably with laboratory equipment) English - from upper-intermediate level
industries: Hospital & Health Care

description: We’re JTI, Japan Tobacco International and we believe in freedom. We think that the possibilities are limitless when you’re free to choose. In fact, we’ve spent the last 20 years innovating, creating new and better products for our consumers to choose from. It’s how we’ve grown to be present in 130 countries.  But our business isn’t just business. Our business is our people. Their talent. Their potential. We believe when they’re free to be themselves, grow, travel and develop, amazing things can happen for our business.  That’s why our employees, from around the world, choose to be a part of JTI. It’s why 9 out of 10 would recommend us to a friend. And why we’ve been awarded Global Top Employer status, six years running.  So when you’re ready to choose a career you’ll love, in a company you’ll love, feel free to #JoinTheIdea.  Learn more jti.com  BRAND ACTIVATION MANAGER, RUSSIAN HERITAGE BRANDS GROUP  Please apply till October 10, 2021  Local applicants are welcome  Department Marketing & Sales  Location Moscow, HQ  Reporting BRAND DIRECTOR, RUSSIAN HERITAGE BRANDS GROUP , Artem Polivyaniy  Role Permanent  What This Position Is About - Purpose  RUSSIAN HERITAGE BRANDS GROUP is responsible for developing strategy and tools to support brands in Russia. We are looking for a passionate marketeer to join our team to help us build and stretch our brands beyond of what is expected to solidify JTI leadership position in the market.  What Will You Do - Responsibilities Manage complex projects focused on product & packaging development in close cooperation with local and global functions Manage Brand performance analysis and consumer insights consolidation to track Brand KPIs and initiatives’ implementation Manage Brand initiatives planning / execution and Brand communication tools development to engage with Consumers, Trade partners and internal audience, in close cooperation with internal functions and external agencies Contribute to strategy development based on consumer insights, competitive challenges and commercial targets, enabling our brands to reach full potential; provide support to the Team with preparation of Brand Reviews, ASP planning and follow-up Establish and maintain effective working relationships with the agencies and internal stakeholders. Who Are We Looking For - Requirements University Degree (preferably Economics, Marketing, Statistics) 3 years in FMCG marketing with proven experience in Successful fulfillment of complex projects involving several internal & external parties; Brand initiatives planning, implementation & analysis; Market / brand performance analysis; Budget planning & control. Brand/Product Manager Level experience English upper-intermediate (spoken, written) Advanced PC user (Excel, Power Point), SAP, PLM, DAM, Nielsen Strong analytical skills with attention to details to forecast and identify consumer trends, market challenges and opportunities Self-disciplined, organized & responsible person with ability to learn quickly Excellent time management and coordination skills, agile, ability to work under time pressure Active team player with entrepreneurial spirit and commercial mindset Positive attitude & proactive life approach, high self-motivation, strong commitment & desire to grow within Brand Marketing function
industries: Consumer Goods, Food & Beverages, and Tobacco

description: About Us  Founded in in 1986, Micromine is a leading provider of next generation technologies for Mining and Exploration businesses. Boasting a suite of award-winning and versatile applications, we have solutions for every stage of the mining process, and with offices in 18 of the world’s mining capitals, we’re growing fast!  What We Offer  A fun, dynamic, and close knit team on a high growth trajectory with the support and benefits of an established market leading company: A competitive salary commensurate with the market. 4 weeks paid vacation. Health cover. A great culture and the opportunity to work with cutting edge Mining and Exploration software. About The Opportunity  Our Sales Operations team, based at our Semenovskaya Square office in Moscow, are currently seeking a Licensing Administrator to join them. In this global role you will support stakeholders (internal and external) with licensing matters, whilst also administering policies, processes, and Micromine’s CRM (Customer Relationship Management) system.  Reporting to the Head of Sales Operations, your key responsibilities will include: Fulfilling license requests globally in line with strict governance. Assisting stakeholders (internal and external) with licensing questions and CRM processes, or redirecting queries to the correct contact person. Ensuring global license records across all systems are up-to-date and accurate. Performing remote updates for products, including helping clients and staff during the remote update process. Maintaining licensing documentation, procedures, and upholding policies. Administering the Micromine CRM and creating ad hoc reports as required. About You  You will have proven experience within administrative positions with ideally some exposure to licensing and / or technology sales.  Other Key Skills, Experience, And Qualifications Fluent in English (written and spoken). Well-versed in supporting clients and providing policy advice. Familiar with the use of CRM and / or ERP (Enterprise Resource Planning) systems (e.g. SalesForce, Netsuite). Next Steps  Ready to join the Micromine team? Apply now or visit www.micromine.com to learn more.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Staffing and Recruiting

description: Community Associate | Community | Moscow  About Us  WeWork began in 2010 with a vision to build the first global physical platform designed to bring people together. Today, we offer access to a desk, an office, a headquarters, or an entire building in hundreds of cities around the world; with over a third of the Fortune 500 companies being part of the WeWork community.  About The Opportunity  As a Community Associate, you'll be the primary point of contact for the Community and act as the “face” of WeWork! You will report to your building each day to support the Community Management team to achieve the following:  Build a welcoming and collaborative community environment amongst our members through events and building relationships between members! Ensure that your building is fully operational and processes are running efficiently. Drive growth and promotion of WeWork-provided service offerings. Take direction from the Community Lead and the Community Manager to support the Community Team and members as necessary. All of this while illustrating WeWork’s core values and working towards achieving our mission.  In This Role, You’ll  Front Desk Management:  Cover the front desk during the building’s set business hours and be an on-site point of contact, easily located on the member floor or at Community Bar. Greet members and guests with a warm and welcoming demeanor. Ensure all visiting guests are in accordance with WeWork's guest policy by ensuring all guests properly sign-in via Welkio iPad. Learn the names of members and guests with the goal of building relationships in order to facilitate the sense of Community WeWork is known for. Anticipate member and guest needs before they arise using relevant information collected about members to enhance and personalize their experience. Ensure building Specific forms are up to date including pet forms, filming requests, bike room requests, etc. Keep the front desk clean and organized. Notify members of any food deliveries and couriers. Answer any questions from members and guests related to the building including way-finding, policies and procedures, community etiquette, etc.  Events And Membership Engagement  Provide feedback on programming types (based on member makeup) and evaluate events based on attendance, satisfaction, and impact to the appropriate event team. Consistently celebrate members’ successes and milestones through gifts and notes. Distribute all necessary info to promote the event including posting of weekly events posters and individual event posters. Ensure building-specific operational requirements are met for each event (elevators, HVAC, etc). Input notes into Spacestation or equivalent system about Members. Identify and execute opportunities to connect members with each other. Know and recommend local restaurants, food delivery services, catering options, team outing venues, post office, shipping center, supply store, etc. Be active on the WeWork member network to engage members. Know and explain WeWork policies and procedures and communicate, inform, and update members on building issues. Write and send broadcasts relating to building updates.  Building Operations And Management  Conduct morning walkthroughs to address any issues, Escalating any recurring issues to your manager and/or relevant cross-functional teams. Receive, process, sort, and organize all mail. Locate and issue post via the regional system to members upon request. Keep the mailroom organized and clean. “Return to Sender' for unidentified mail and former member mail after 30 days of no-pick up. Ensure courier parcels have all the correct details for scheduled pick-ups. Investigate, escalate, and resolve 'lost' packages. Know and explain WeWork policies and procedures around mail and mailroom. Track, audit, and organize keys collected and distributed. Manage keycard stock and request new inventory as needed. Collect keys and key cards upon move-out. Review location and how to use each piece of Emergency Equipment. Provide support for an automated coffee machine for guests and members.  About You  We’d love to hear from you if you meet the qualifications below:  Customer service and/or sales experience a plus. Strong verbal and written communication skills. Exceptional organizational and multitasking skills. Ability to remain positive in a high pressure environment and embrace constant challenges with a can do attitude. Demonstrate integrity, dependability, responsibility, accountability, self-awareness, work ethic, and empathy. Passion for entrepreneurial communities. Strong proficiency in Russian and English are required.  If this sounds like you, please submit an English version of your CV/Resume.  Life at WeWork  Just as we empower our community, we believe in empowering our team to create their own life's work. We move fast and challenge each other, but we always make sure we look out for one another. Our culture and values are what make working here rewarding.  We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Learn more about diversity at WeWork here.

description: We are Simple. Simple is a nutrition app based on intermittent fasting with automated tracking of what your body goes through during the day, healthy lifestyle insights and a community of 11+ members globally. The company collaborates with doctors and health researchers to develop science-based solutions that are 100% safe.  We are part of the Palta family, a venture company that's launched and developed a number of globally renowned health products. Our mission is to give day-to-day personal insight into people's nutrition leading to healthier lives through behavior change.  Our Creative and Growth teams are at the forefront of communicating with prospective customers. We're looking for a full-time Marketing Copywriter to help across these two departments and fit into their workflow.  On Creative and Growth we are the gatekeepers of the brand voice and image, so we make key-value creative assets to deliver the philosophy and storytelling behind our methodology. The overall task for Simple's Marketing Copywriter is to bring the brand to life across the spectrum of digital and traditional platforms. The instruments are diverse.  You will work collaboratively with the Creative team on direct response and key-value video ads. With the support of analysts, engineers, growth leaders, and our co-founders you will work on assets that drive sales. You will also help establish the tone and messaging that will directly and positively impact the growth of our digital product.  Through direct response and creating on-brand concepts, writing, editing, and proofreading, you will help tell our story across all consumer-facing touchpoints, with an emphasis on highly engaging and convertible video ads.  The ideal candidate will be responsible for: Creating direct response ads that compel millions of people to take the first step in changing their lives for the better. You'll create for Facebook, TikTok, Snapchat, Pinterest, Twitter, in-app ads, and any other paid social sources that fit our goals. Working directly with the Art Director, Brand and Product Copy Lead, and internal creative team (producers, illustrators, and motion designers) to create compelling ads that drive conversion, sign up, and retention. Pitching and brainstorming ad/branding ideas that propel the brand into the stratosphere. Collaborating with external creative partners to ensure they produce content that supports our vision and brand voice/messaging.  Examples of creative assets in Creative Marketing: Facebook news feed banners/videos (scripts + copy) Instagram stories (concepts + copy) YouTube pre-rolls (scripts + copy) App store descriptions (copy)  Examples of assets in Growth Marketing: Onboarding flow Landing pages Emails and newsletters Push notifications and modals (in-app messages)  The Marketing Copywriter will oversee content creation, copywriting, execution, and daily maintenance for marketing assets across Simple's user acquisition funnel. You will explore new channels Simple can engage with and analyze data to determine the effectiveness of past campaigns.  Please apply if you have: A minimum of 4-5 years of working in mobile marketing (subscription products), or copywriting for an advertising agency or startup A portfolio and a proven track record of increasing user acquisition and engagement through copy Ability to adjust to an agile environment Ability to execute under deadlines Experience in concepting communication strategies for advertising campaigns Native English speaker Understanding of acquisition KPIs and complex funnels is appreciated  Why working at Simple is incredible: Competitive salary Equipment Work-life balance to suit everyone: flexible working hours, remote-first approach Paid leave: paid sick days and ample PTO A global, diverse workforce Learning and development stipend: take classes, read some books, and continue to grow + get the materials you need to work and be at your best We have a passionate and highly skilled international team You will join a company disrupting the health industry Simple is supported by a large and stable investor = we don't need to worry about funding
industries: Computer Software

description: The Big Picture  Howden are a global engineering business who focus on providing clients with industrial products that help multiple sectors improve their everyday processes. Howden’s core focus is on providing quality solutions for air and gas handling, and have over a century of experience in doing so.  As an AFM & Service Sales Engineer, you will manage spare parts and service sales; formulate proposals; initiate, support and manage contracts and equipment commissioning in Russia and CIS  What Needs To Be Done? Achieve performance targets in sales volume and profit margin. Implement Howden equipment development strategy in Russia and CIS. Continuous professional development, accumulation of knowledge obtained through training and practice and its application. What Do You Need To Bring? Higher education 3 years of relevant working experience in sales Market and customer base insight A good networker who is able to install and maintain good relationships with clients, sales representatives and internal customers Advanced PC user: Microsoft Office – Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, etc. Experienced in direct sales, as well as in sales and distribution channel management Strong skills in sales and customer base / market cultivation Strong negotiation and customer problem solving skills Strong interpersonal skills: active listening, concise clear-cut communication (both: oral and written); skills of teamwork Strong analytical abilities Strong presentation skills A self-starter with efficient time management, planning and use of client communication channels Ability to work on ever-changing priorities and requirements What Will You Get in Return?  You will have the opportunity to work for a global engineering organization in a challenging and dynamic role with great development opportunities. We offer a competitive salary along with a great benefits package.  The Advantages Of Working At Howden  Worldwide business – Liaise with our colleagues in 27 countries.  We offer global and local opportunities– 6000 employees and world leading engineers, who create cutting edge developments – You will be a part of over 160 years of innovation and development that continues today with our digital solutions. At Howden we have a strong corporate identity and purpose – You will be a member of our team, shaping the future of the world and tackling some of the most pressing issues facing the planet.  Our products and organization are Revolving Around You – Our culture promotes individual development to enhance our most important asset – our people.

description: Department: None Description   SUMMARY OF ROLE  The Inside Sales Engineer supports sales engineers of systems and flow meters in the region, is responsible for the development of relationships with Customers, negotiations with Customers, consulting Customers on products and solutions, interaction with technical services of the Customer and design institutes, in order to influence the technical policy of the Customer , preparation of technical and commercial proposals (TCH), interaction with the Customer Support Center in Chelyabinsk in terms of preparing the technical part of the TCH (quotations) and placing orders. SPECIFIC JOB RESPONSIBILITIES •    Ensuring the fulfillment of sales plans in the assigned region. Responsibility for delivering results in conjunction with the sales engineers for systems and flow meters in the region. •    Participation in negotiations with the Customer •    Supporting the Customer in the choice of products and solutions for flow measurement, explaining to the Customers the technological and other advantages of the products being sold •    Consultation of Customers on products and solutions by phone and at the Customer's site •    Interaction between the technical services of the Customer and design institutes to influence the technical policy of the Customer •    Liaising with Emerson manufacturing facilities on equipment lead times, customer specific requirements, etc. •    Identification of any opportunities for the sale of additional products and services and their timely escalation to sales engineers of systems and flow meters in the region •    Processing incoming requests for technical commercial offers preparation from employees of the sales service of systems and flow meters in the region, as well as employees of the sales service of other departments in the region. •    Timely informing the management about the requirements and problems of Customers, the activities of competitors and opportunities for other divisions of the company. •    Carrying out an analysis of competitors' proposals, issuing technical opinions on the advantages and disadvantages of Emerson's proposals, interaction in this part with the marketing department •    Preparation of documentation (information) required for placing orders in accordance with corporate rules. •    Interaction with business development managers (products and industries) •    Interact with product and solution experts •    Interaction with the marketing department •    Processing incoming requests: •    Implementation of prompt and timely processing of customer requests received from sales engineers in the region •    Registration of incoming requests and TCP in the CRM registration system •    Analysis of customers' requests, clarification of details on contacts, technical information, questionnaires, etc. with sales engineers or Customers if required. •    Departure to the object for a meeting with the engineering services of the Customer to clarify the technical parameters of the request, inspection, if necessary  TCP preparation:  •    Preparation of a technical proposal, considering the recommendations for the preparation of quotas and general rules of quotas with a focus on meeting the requirements of a specific application and enterprises of the Customer, •    Selection of the optimal technical solution for a specific application, competitive from a business point of view, involving business development managers (products / industries), product and solution experts, marketing department (if necessary) in the process of selecting a technical solution •    Coordination and distribution of tasks for the preparation of the technical part of the TCP (quotations) with the Customer Support Center in Chelyabinsk, leading the process of preparing quotations, consolidating work results, monitoring compliance with the quality and timing of preparation of quotations from the Customer Support Center •    Determination of equipment parameters and analysis of technical parameters in the Symphony quotation preparation system •    Registration of TCP in SharePoint and CRM systems. •    Registration of the entire TCP (according to the terms of the tender, customer requirements, etc.), correction of the TCP according to the comments of the sales engineer / Customer. •    Calculation of the cost of products in accordance with the price list, indication of the cost of equipment in the TCP based on the discount agreed with the sales engineer, in accordance with the company's policy •    Calculation of delivery times (using Prospectus for Metran products and Automated Prospectus for Flow Measurement products), considering the possibility of production. •    When ready, transfer of TCP to sales engineers or the Customer (with the approval of the sales engineer) •    Explaining to the Customer the details of the TCP, adjusting the TCP based on the comments •    Consulting contract administrators of the Customer Support Center in terms of placing orders for production  Customer support •    Timely response to the Customer's claims regarding the execution of the supply agreement, delivery time, etc. escalation of the facts of contacting the sales engineer in the region and the Customer Support Center (head of the department of contract administrators) •    Timely response to the Customer's claims regarding the characteristics and operability of the supplied equipment - escalation of the facts of contacting the service organization (leader of the Flow service group) •    Assistance to the service engineer in organizing the maintenance of equipment on the site Other responsibilities •    Compliance with corporate ethics requirements. •    Escalation of any foreign trade regulation issues to the appropriate person (gatekeeper) in accordance with the established procedure. •    Other responsibilities in accordance with reasonable requirements.     REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE •    Higher technical / engineering education •    In-depth knowledge of flow measurement technologies, typical applications of various types of flow meters in various industries. Knowledge of the products of the main manufacturers of flow meters •    At least 3 years of experience as a technical specialist in the field of flow measurement, metrological equipment or sales engineer for measuring equipment. •    Ability to accurately conduct financial calculations, navigate well and be accurate in providing commercial information •    Excellent communication skills, be able to convey and substantiate the necessary information to the Customer technically competently •    Skills of negotiating with the Customer •    Confident PC user (Outlook, Excel, Word, PowerPoint), easily trained for specific software •    The level of proficiency in English is not lower than the Intermediate level •    Diligence, activity, ability to work both in a team and independently.  Primary Location  Russia-Chelyabinsk Region-Chelyabinsk  Job Function  Manufacturing & Operations  Date  Oct 5, 2021, 12:01:26 PM

description: Company  Learnlight is an EdTech company that provides language, intercultural and soft skills training to leading companies and organizations around the world. We deliver blended virtual, blended face-to-face, and digital solutions to 100,000+ learners in 1500+ clients across 150+ countries. We specialize in the digital transformation of learning programs and the empowerment of talent to excel in an increasingly complex global environment.     Position  Global Mobility Language Program Managers are responsible for successfully managing the lifecycle of language training requirements with our clients and to ensure high quality of program set up and training delivery. They need to have ongoing communication with assignees through the duration of training and coordinate with other Learnlight departments so that we meet and exceed training objectives.  The task involved are in the following areas:  Supporting the Sales team by maximizing existing clients Managing programs Supporting assignees and client support Collaborating with the Product division Internal departmental support and reporting    Responsibilities  Supporting the Growth division in maximizing existing clients  Helping maximize client revenue and profitability converting authorisations/initiations Identifying potential up-sell or cross-sell opportunities with existing relocation companies Collaborating in reporting, investigating and solving learners’ low ratings Escalating non-standard Learnlight programs and assignees complaints Managing Programs  Receiving and activating authorizations/initiations  Understanding program requirements, conditions and policies agreed with the client Creating accounts, learners, and contracts in the Learnlight platform and checking for Dynamics synchronization Contacting assignee, sends PTQ, arranges and conducts interviews  Ensuring program evaluations are sent, gathered, and distributed  Ensuring Program Reports are requested and completed properly Transferring required information to trainer management teams for program coordination Monitoring low attendance Monitoring low platform ratings Ensuring platform contracts include proper billing details Collaborating with Regional Head of Program Management in completing and amending monthly billing report details when there is a need Assignee and Client Support   Maintaining a positive, empathetic, and professional attitude towards customers at all time Greeting customers warmly and ascertaining their reason for calling Resolving product or service problems by: clarifying the customer's complaint; determining the cause of the problem; selecting and explaining the best solution to solve the problem; expediting correction or adjustment; following up to ensure resolution. Handling complaints, providing appropriate solutions and alternatives within the SLA and following up to ensure resolution Keep records of customer interactions, transactions, comments, and complaints through Dynamics Meeting SLA (service level management) standards and achieving superior customer service  Escalating complaints to GAC’s been needed Collaborating with the Product division   Demonstrating agility and autonomy with Learnlight tools (SharePoint, Learnlight platform, Dynamics, etc.) Recommending potential products or services through customer feedback and needs analysis Suggesting solutions, enhancements, or new features Reporting to the Technology when the platform does not work as expected Internal departmental support and reporting   Meeting metrics for case volume, availability, and customer satisfaction Working collaboratively to solve customer issues as efficiently as possible Reporting customer complaints and escalating when necessary to prevent    Required Skills    Competencies  Strong telephone handling skills and active listening Strong organizational skills with demonstrated administrative professionalism and responsiveness   Proactive with team spirit who thrives under pressure Ability to multi-task, prioritize and manage time effectively Customer orientation and ability to adapt to different profiles, including managing difficult conversations. Needs to be a problem-solver, always looking to resolve conflict Customer service skills: courtesy and kindness in dealing with our clients and learners Demonstrates our core values: enthusiasm, commitment, initiative Skills  C1 or higher level of English Advanced level of MS Office and related tools, proactive approach to learning new systems    Benefits    People-Powered Culture: We have a flat, modern, meritocratic culture that values enthusiasm, initiative and commitment above all else.   Flexible Working: Learnlight is a fully distributed virtual business with staff in 30+ countries and offices in 9 European cities, so you get to choose where you work.    Learning & Development: Personalized language and soft skills training; ongoing professional development talks and masterclasses; frequent coaching and constructive feedback.    Diversity & Inclusion: Learnlight fosters an open, positive, and diverse community which welcomes talent regardless of gender, religion, ethnicity, sexual orientation, age or disability.    Community Events: We offer a range of social events including Virtual Drinks, Book Club, Tea Time, and in-person departmental and All Company meetups.     Details    Location: Home-based/Remote/Virtual Schedule: +/-2-3 hours of European time zone   Contract: Full-time, Freelance
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Information Technology and Services, and Online Media

 Account statements on quarterly basis or by request;  Calculating documents of bank guarantee compensations, penalties, reclamation claims with all necessary documentation;  Calculate monthly accrual of prepayment and early-payment bonuses;  Assurnet reconciliation (accounting reconciliation);  Clearing sales out of stock, check stock adjustments;  Maintaining write-off process;  Preparation of daily reporting (Overdue reports);  Manual release the orders in SAP (check on compliance with the rules of corporate credit policy and credit decisions);  Preparing and further maintaining of register of received personal guarantees and corporate guarantees;  Back up of credit manager on credit committees;  Checking calculations for customers with specific payment terms, maintain the necessary changes in SAP accordingly;  Preparation additional agreements (bank guarantees, personal agreements, additional agreements of credit limit; specific payments terms);  Analysis of customer’s financial statements to assess it’s creditworthiness; maintaining of Potential Debt list);  Participate in factoring process (Preparing documents for providing factoring between customer and bank, Posting of factoring deals in SAP);  Internal & External accounting control (Provide the requested information for internal/external audit and users; Preparing all requested documents, calculations for auditors and tax departments; Daily communication with customers on the subject of two-party related documents and outstanding balances; Provide in time all type of reports requested from Management team);  Monthly preparation of SOX reconciliation (documents and reports);  Treasury department support in order to avoid any risks related to currency control;  100% compliance with monthly closing and reporting deadlines, including monthly account reconciliation.  Goodyear is one of the world’s largest tire companies. It employs about 65,000 people and manufactures its products in 48 facilities in 22 countries around the world. From classic must-haves to the latest trends, our selection of quality, responsibly-sourced jewelry has become part of so many love stories over the last century. description: Salary And Benefits  26 days holiday, including a day off for your Birthday, dental plan, career progression, employee assistance programme plus other excellent benefits you’d expect from a leading global organisation  Our opportunity  Our Subsidence teams support our business in proactively handling and settling Subsidence claims for our valued Clients. Due to continued growth, we’re looking for and Administration Assistant to provide additional support.  What You'll Be Doing  You’ll be supporting our Subsidence team with a wide range of administration tasks, including Management of travel requirements for Managers and effective cost control, Diary Management for meetings, induction and training schedules of new employees and event organisation.  It’s a busy and friendly team, so you’ll need to be well organised, methodical and be able to prioritise your workload. You’ll also have the opportunity to support our Sales and Account Management activities, so you’ll also be dealing with third parties, fielding calls and have input and supporting various projects, as well as assisting the Operations Managers with Audit processes and financial reports.  The key to this role is communication: keeping our teams informed and up to date with requests, providing a first class service to ensure we stay on track with tasks and ensuring effective communication at all times.  About You  We’re looking for talent: those that enjoy supporting a team and adding value. Previous insurance or a similar industry background will be an advantage, but we’d like to hear from you if you have a similar commercial background. Additionally, we’d like you to have: Previous commercial Administration experience in supporting managers or teams Exceptional organisation and diary management skills Strong financial literacy skills to utilise financial reporting information and insurance performance measures Strong relationship building skills – engaging with all parties, providing support and help when it’s most needed Excellent MS office skills – Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook, with a keen eye for detail Flexibility in travelling on adhoc occasions for training and meetings Due to the nature of our work, this role requires a satisfactory basic DBS check.  Equal Opportunities  Crawford & Company actively supports Equal Opportunities and embraces Diversity and Inclusion. So what are you waiting for? Apply today, we’re looking forward to your application.

jobTitle: Clinical Research Associate - Sign on Bonus
location: St Petersburg, St Petersburg City, Russia
description: Overview  Medpace is a full-service clinical contract research organization (CRO). We provide Phase I-IV clinical development services to the biotechnology, pharmaceutical and medical device industries. Our mission is to accelerate the global development of safe and effective medical therapeutics through its scientific and disciplined approach. We leverage local regulatory and therapeutic expertise across all major areas including oncology, cardiology, metabolic disease, endocrinology, central nervous system, anti-viral and anti-infective. Headquartered in Cincinnati, Ohio, employing approximately 3,500 people across almost 40 countries.  Job Summary  Our clinical activities are growing rapidly, and we are currently seeking full-time, office or home based Clinical Research Associates to join our Clinical Monitoring team. This position will work with a team to accomplish tasks and projects that are instrumental to the company’s success. If you want an exciting career where you use your previous expertise and can develop and grow your career even further, then this is the opportunity for you.  Additionally, a Sign-On Bonus of up to 200,000 RUB is possible for CRA's hired with at least 1.5 years of CRA experience.  The Clinical Research Associate at Medpace is offered the unique opportunity to be involved at every stage of the drug development process by providing unrivaled support to our customers. If you want an exciting career where you use your medical or health background and education, travel extensively and are instrumental in the clinical trials process, this could be the opportunity for you. Our successful Clinical Research Associates possess varied backgrounds in the medical and related healthcare fields. Individuals who have succeeded in the CRA role include Registered Nurses, Dieticians, Pharmacy Technicians, Pharmaceutical Sales Representatives and Research Assistants. An extensive training program provides the platform to effectively and confidently carry out your duties.  Responsibilities Conduct pre-study, initiation, monitoring, and closeout visits for research sites; Perform source document verification and case report form review; Perform regulatory document review; Conduct study drug inventory; Perform adverse event and serious adverse event reporting and follow-up; and Assess patient recruitment and retention. Qualifications Bachelor of Science in health-related field, MD or equivalent; Broad knowledge of medical terminology and clinical patient management; Basic knowledge of drug therapy techniques and clinical research methodologies; Fluency in Russian as well as English language; Previous CRA experience. PLEASE SEND YOUR CV IN ENGLISH LANGUAGE TO: Russiajobs@medpace.com  Why Medpace?  When you join Medpace, you become part of a team dedicated to supporting the development of ground-breaking drugs and devices. Our employees provide hope for those living with debilitating diseases. We invite you to be a part of something that is impacting millions of people around the globe while enjoying a competitive total compensation and benefits package and internal growth opportunities.  Awards Medpace historically named a Top Cincinnati Workplace by the Cincinnati Enquirer Recognized by Forbes as one of America's Best Mid-size Companies in 2021 Medpace ranks amongst top CROs for site ratings across all 10 important attributes including CRA training, preparation & organization, accessibility of staff, open communication, and ensuring timely drug availability Continually recognized with CRO Leadership Awards from Life Science Leader magazine based on expertise, quality, capabilities, reliability, and compatibility What To Expect Next  A member of our recruitment team will review your qualifications and, if interested, you will be contacted for an interview.  EO/AA Employer M/F/Disability/Vets WARNING: Please beware of phishing scams that offer opportunities with Medpace in exchange for sending money. These scammers pose as legitimate employees from actual companies. Please be advised that a Medpace employee will never ask you for a credit card, send you a check, or ask you for any type of payment as part of consideration for a role with our company. All of our careers require that you first complete an online application and go through some sort of interview process.
industries: Biotechnology, Hospital & Health Care, and Pharmaceuticals

description: parcelLab, the leading Operations Experience Management platform, is growing internationally, and fast! We're looking for the best talent from across the world to help us bring people and brands closer together.  We are looking for a full-time Deal Desk Analyst to join our Revenue Operations Team. The position will report to the Global Head of Sales Operations. This person is a key enabler of deal formation and execution with a focus on minimizing sales cycle times while optimising revenue, profitability and deal quality.  What You Can Expect Engage with the sales team to accelerate deal velocity Collaborate with impacted parties to identify acceptable options to facilitate deal closure Run end of period cadence to effective manage resources and provide appropriate visibility/escalations Partner with Sales Operations on process/system improvements, sales enablement and special projects Deliver relevant training to new and existing sales people on deal desk, order processes and overall QTC best practices Serve as the trusted adviser to account management team on all renewal deal related matters, advise the team on alternative contract options, and/or value propositioning to help drive deal closures Manage the day-to-day renewal management, ensuring compliance with published sales and business approval policies  What You Need To Succeed 2+ years of proven success in Enterprise SaaS/B2B Industry, Deal Desk, Finance, Sales Operations or Pricing experience preferred Strong understanding of software revenue recognition and order process principles required Strong business acumen Strong reporting and analytics, troubleshooting, problem-solving, Great project management skills Demonstrated ability to partner with GTM Teams and other cross functional departments Ability to multitask and prioritize at times of high volume Strong quantitative skills and highly proficient in Excel, Salesforce.com or similar CPQ tools Ability to thrive in a fully remote organisation Excellent oral and written communication skills in English  Nice To Haves Previous experience working in a start-up environment Knowledge of the retail/ecommerce sector Perks & Benefits: Plenty of room for your own ideas...space to try, fail and learn! As a digital first company, you choose whether to work entirely from home, in one of our offices or a mix that suits you Keep growing with our online language courses, company training program, professional development budgets and access to LinkedIn Learning Make use of our home office set-up budget to get kitted out (a spacious desk, comfy chair, some houseplants and more) Stay grounded with our free weekly yoga and meditation classes Be part of a motivated, diverse and international team, which consists not only of colleagues, but future friends About parcelLab  We bring people and brands closer together by closing the experience gap post-sales and beyond, transforming operational complexity into opportunities to outperform for 500+ brands worldwide, including IKEA, Bose, Puma, Farfetch and Nespresso.  With offices in Munich, London, Paris and New York, we have been highlighted by the Financial Times as one of the fastest-growing technology companies in Europe in 2021.  It’s all in a day’s work for us: Monitor over three million shipments per day Now actively managing operations experiences in 153 countries across the globe Send around seven million pro-active, personalized, event-driven emails Shipping data comes from more than 150+ carriers worldwide, including DHL, FedEx & DPD Creating over 30 million reasons for people to fall in love with brands each day For brands, that means more chances to create relationships that last. And for the people that buy from them, it means turning mundane operational moments into moments of joy.  Equal Opportunities  parcelLab is an Equal Opportunities Employer. We live the motto always joy, always team, always equality, which means we celebrate diversity and do not accept any form of discrimination or harassment. We believe that diversity enriches our employee experience and allows each of us to deliver the best work possible.  Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, disability status or other lived experience.  Come be part of our growth – contribute your ideas and share in our success as we continue to improve the post-sales customer journey for millions of people very day.
