description: Job Description:  Summary:  Rakuten was founded in 1997 and is the world’s first successful merchant-focused e-commerce marketplace. Rakuten now encompasses over 70 businesses worldwide spanning e-commerce, digital content, communications and fintech that reach more than 1 billion members around the globe. You may have seen our logo as sponsors, on the jerseys of The Golden State Warriors who won the 2017 NBA Championship or FC Barcelona.  A fantastic opportunity has arisen for an Engineer (Customer Integration) to join the Operations team at Rakuten Advertising. Rakuten Advertiisng is the marketing and advertising arm of Rakuten, focussed on helping the world’s leading brands find new customers and maximise the returns from their advertising budgets.  We offer a great place to work, learn and grow professionally. Our team partners daily with top internet retailers in the e-commerce space to handle the key components of their Affiliate, Search or Display campaigns. Campaigns which are built to create and support distribution opportunities, drive new customer sales and increase their business' ROI. This is an exciting opportunity to be part of an expanding global organisation that is focused on helping their employees grow alongside the company.  The Engineer (Customer Integration) is responsible for supporting our client’s technical needs throughout their lifecycle within the Rakuten Marketing ecosystem. This can include, but is not limited to, attending technical exploration meetings with internal stakeholders or external clients to support the best tracking strategy; providing correct website tracking codes and instructions for client implementation; performing tracking QA and troubleshooting post integration inquiries.  The ideal candidate will be highly responsive, able to communicate to a technical & non-technical audience, and adept at providing custom solutions, when necessary. This is an exciting opportunity to work with global teams to solve client integration needs, either through a single channel or multiple ones. Your ongoing goal is to provide a positive customer experience within and outside of Rakuten Marketing.  Roles & Responsibilities:  We’re looking for a self-starter and finisher, who has a passion for creative problem-solving. Strong candidates will innately seek to learn new technologies and tools as needed & stay up to date on industry trends to improve their comprehensive knowledge and application of Rakuten Marketing Integration solutions. Assist new & existing clients with Rakuten Marketing technical integration, including: Sharing integration instructions, confirming technical set up, tracking testing & validation and ensuring relevant consumer privacy policies are applied Establish and maintain regular and appropriate communication with launch stakeholders, internal & external Learn and understand the full capabilities of Rakuten Marketing tools and technologies Set clear expectations and advocate for most effective integrated solution based on the campaign goals and available Rakuten Marketing technology & partnerships Troubleshoot, escalate and respond to client tracking and reporting inquiries & requests, as appropriate Manage post-launch tracking inquiries, to maintain tracking integrity and protect revenue Analyse & improve the client launch process where opportunity exists or business needs change Create and Maintain launch process documentation and define best practice guidelines to support the client’s lifecycle and internal team’s workflows Identify potential new tracking solutions to be reviewed by Product Development team. Required Skills and Experience: Candidate will have a minimum of 2-3+ years’ experience in technical support, or IT consulting role working with enterprise, web-based software solutions: specifically coding, testing/QA, and troubleshooting. Successful candidates may bring experience from an agency, client, or consulting environment. Bachelor’s degree Computer Science or Engineering preferred. Knowledge of digital marketing and basic concepts of affiliate, display or search marketing Technical knowledge and enthusiasm for digital trends, analytics tools, best practices and data-driven solutions with the ability to learn and adapt to new concepts Ability to multi-task & prioritise tasks, despite competing needs, in a fast-paced environment to meet deadlines Understands the impact of decisions on company’s short and long-term goals Excellent time management, follow-up and organisational skills. Attention to detail is priority. Great relationship-building skills; Ability to liaise between internal, cross-functional global teams and external clients on a day-to-day basis Exemplary verbal, written & presentation communication skills Must be able to quickly develop facility with proprietary software to manage and review launch status. Technical / functional expertise Proficient knowledge in JavaScript & HTML Proficient web development and cookie tracking skills Proficient knowledge of advertising tag management (Google Tag Manager), tag container, CMS systems & 3rd party pixel tracking Experience with Node.js, PHP, SQL, ASP etc. Experience with databases, shopping carts, FTP, RSS/XML feeds Knowledge in web analytics, tracking and reporting Experience in mobile app tracking and Software Development Kit (SDK) implementations Solid proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite – Word, Excel and PowerPoint for client-ready reports & presentations RAKUTEN SHUGI PRINCIPLES Our worldwide practices describe specific behaviors that make Rakuten unique and united across the world. We expect Rakuten employees to model these 5 Shugi Principles of Success. Always improve, always advance. Only be satisfied with complete success - Kaizen. Be passionately professional. Take an uncompromising approach to your work and be determined to be the best. Hypothesise - Practice - Validate - Shikumika. Use the Rakuten Cycle to success in unknown territory. Maximise Customer Satisfaction. The greatest satisfaction for workers in a service industry is to see their customers smile. Speed!! Speed!! Speed!! Always be conscious of time. Take charge, set clear goals, and engage your team.
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Computer Software, and Internet

description: ABBYY – ведущий мировой разработчик решений в области интеллектуальной обработки информации и анализа бизнес-процессов. Десятки тысяч организаций свыше чем в 200 странах мира используют решения ABBYY, чтобы улучшить критически важные для бизнеса показатели. Среди наших заказчиков – DHL, PepsiCo, Volkswagen, Fesco, Сбербанк, Райффайзенбанк, PwC, МТС, S7 и другие. Офисы группы компаний ABBYY открыты в 14 странах мира, в них работают более 1 200 сотрудников.  Системный аналитик является частью международной команды Sales Operations, коллеги находятся в разных офисах присутствия ABBYY, поэтому в работе будет активно использоваться английский язык. Вам предстоит принимать участие в проектах автоматизации на базе облачной системы Salesforce.  Основные обязанности Анализ требований на автоматизацию процессов; Разработка системных требований; Настройка приложения, используя стандартную функциональность SFDC; Постановка задач команде разработки; Поддержка документации в актуальном состоянии; Поддержка пользователей в качестве специалиста 3 линии. Требования Наличие опыта работы от 1 года в качестве системного аналитика или консультанта внедрения в IT, в качестве плюса опыт работы с SalesForce; Английский B2 (Upper Intermediate) и выше; Навыки по описанию бизнес-процессов и подготовке технических заданий на разработку; В качестве плюса будет понимание бизнес-процессов в продажах и маркетинге. Знание терминологии CRM (лиды, интересы, возможности, сделки, воронка продаж, этапы продаж) и как они связаны между собой; Знание методологий описания бизнес-процессов и ведения IT-проектов. Мы предлагаем  Гибкий график  В ABBYY большинство сотрудников работают по гибкому графику. Сотрудники самостоятельно определяют, когда им нужно решить те или иные задачи для эффективного достижения поставленных целей. Некоторые команды по согласованию с руководителем работают в полностью удаленном или в гибридном формате.  Возможность профессионально развиваться и расти  Для сотрудников проводятся регулярные образовательные лекции от публичных спикеров и внутренних экспертов, открыт доступ к образовательным платформам для самостоятельного развития. Компания компенсирует покупку профессиональной литературы и частично покрывает занятия иностранными языками, а также предоставляет возможность публиковать научные статьи и принимать участие в различных конференциях, внешних и внутренних тренингах.  Здоровье и спорт  У нас качественная программа ДМС, включающая стоматологию, полис для выезжающих за рубеж, программу АнтиОнко, услуги телемедицины и консультации психолога. Мы предлагаем льготные условия оформления страховки для членов семьи, в офисе принимает врач-терапевт. Для сотрудников проводятся регулярные онлайн-занятия спортом, также компания частично компенсирует затраты на занятия в фитнес-клубах или спортивных секциях.  У нас работают дружелюбные, творческие и талантливые люди. Вместе мы создаем решения в области искусственного интеллекта, ввода документов и обработки данных, которые помогают превращать информацию в полезные знания.  Ждем Вас в ABBYY!
industries: Computer Software, Information Technology and Services, and Internet

description: HENKEL IS FOR THOSE WHO STEP UP. DO YOU?  At Henkel, you can make a difference and craft your career. That's why you own your projects and take full responsibility from an early stage. Our unique brands in markets around the world open up countless opportunities to follow your convictions and explore new paths. If you have an entrepreneurial mindset that allows you to always think out of the box - take the chance and shape the digital future together with us.  YOUR ROLE Technical Customer Service Engineer for Henkel Vehicle Repair & Maintenance (VRM) SBU Drive top projects including new product initiatives Engage and involve in all Sales and Marketing initiatives and programs Specialized training for customers - Distribution, OES, Glass fitters, fleet, Agri & MOD Training/upskilling of local internal team i.e Technical Sales Engineers Country Technology webinars with local marketing Local/regional product certifications Excellent team working relationship with Sales and Marketing team Respond promptly to customer calls and queries Be responsible for customer applications, providing technical information and recommending products and methods of use for customer applications in order to develop sales of our products Ensure to be up to date with the newest trends in application technology for the markets served by Henkel VRM Be the first customer for new products developed by the R&D department by testing the appropriate application methods for these new materials. Prepare detailed test reports for new initiatives or existing products Represent Henkel VRM at conferences, trade shows and meetings regarding avenues of research and new advances YOUR SKILLS Engineering graduate - (Mechanical, Industrial, Chemical or similar) Minimum 3-5 years experience in a related field Knowledge in vehicle repair&maintenance and automotive aftermarket is a plus Knowledge of automotive aftermarket repair methods and technologies is a plus Preferably hands-on experience in a technical service or manufacturing role in automotive market Fluency in English (written&spoken) is a must Strong presentation, communication skills, proficient in MS office.(Excel/Powerpoint/Word) Prepared to travel (regular short term business trips in the area of responsibility to customers and other facilities) Driving license "B"

description: Description  Position at NAPA Auto Parts  Job Description  Imagine the position to use your automotive or customer service expertise with both our wholesale and retail customers on a daily basis, serve as a leader to your teammates, and lead NAPA to be the dominant parts supplier in the market. If this sounds like you, NAPA is looking for a passionate Assistant Store Manager. This is the right opportunity for you if you:  Responsibilities Enjoy creating a superior customer service experience to achieve maximum market penetration, drive store growth, increase sales and profitability Know how to provide daily leadership and create and sustain a culture of employee engagement Know the importance of partnering with your teammates in order to drive company owned store initiatives Care about people and profit Want to join a team where you can learn and grow your career the opportunities are endless! A Day in the life: Lead a successful team, support the store manager, and manage in our fast-paced retail stores Manage store operations to maximize sales, profits and customer service Build, coach, train and engage crew team to deliver superior levels of customer care and business results Inventory protection, asset management, operational and safety issues Overall cleanliness and readiness of delivery vehicles, sales floor, stock room and outside areas Drive NAPA operational and marketing programs while steering toward continuous improvement in processes and procedures Grow customer relationships, help with sales/service questions, and ensure a positive experience both in the store and on the phone Qualifications High school diploma or equivalent. Technical or trade school courses or degree completion. Experience in the automotive after-market service industry or hobby/DIY world, or at least the willingness to learn all things automotive. Passion for delivering customer care and building long term relationships Thrive off of working in a very fast paced and complex environment. Knowledge of cataloging and/or inventory management systems Ability to lift 60lbs in some situations And if you have this, even better: Background and/or passion for automotive industry, heavy equipment, farm industry, diesel, marine, or dealership. Experience in a parts store, auction, retail store, auto body/collision, or fast food/restaurant/convenience store management experience Entirely customer-centric (external/internal) ASE Certifications NAPA Know How Why NAPA may be the right place for you: Outstanding health benefits and 401K Stable company. Fortune 200 with a family feel Company Culture that works hard, yet takes care of employees Opportunity for accessing multiple career paths, ongoing development, with support from leaders and your team Additional Information For You  NAPA has great careers for people with all backgrounds and interests. So if after reading this, you dont think that it is the perfect fit for you, check out a few of our cool day in the life career videos from our awesome employees by visiting NAPAautojobs.com. While on our career site, check out the list of the many other diverse roles we have as well. We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.  Where permitted by applicable law, successful applicants must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to start date. COVID-19 vaccination is a condition of employment, subject to an approved accommodation, and proof of vaccination will be required on or prior to start date.  GPC conducts its business without regard to sex, race, creed, color, religion, marital status, national origin, citizenship status, age, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, disability, military status, status as a veteran, or any other protected characteristic. GPC's policy is to recruit, hire, train, promote, assign, transfer and terminate employees based on their own ability, achievement, experience and conduct and other legitimate business reasons.

description: APPLICATIONS ENGINEER FISHING TOOLS  JOIN OUR FISHING TOOLS TEAM  The Applications Engineer ensures Baker Hughes can deliver flawless execution through involvement in pre- planning, job execution, and post-job analysis. This position delivers a technical job program that maximizes our opportunity to meet the job objectives in line with the contract terms and conditions. This position works seamlessly together with the Service Delivery Coordinators and other resources across organizational boundaries to ensure all aspects and constraints of the application are understood and have been considered.  Partner with the best:  As an Application Engineer Fishing Tools you will be responsible for:  Ensuring compliance with Manage the Job Cycle (MtJC) process Working with the assigned Service Delivery Coordinator/Salesman to understand the client's well construction or production objectives as well as the commercial terms for Baker Hughes (i.e. outcome based contract, line item contract etc.] Performing offset well/similar job analysis to understand application hazards and incident potential Working together with all disciplines and stakeholders to ensure all aspects and constraints of the application and suggested products/services has been considered Designing a job program, including risk mitigation plans and contingency plans, that can meet the client's objective and maximize revenue potential and future job assignments for Baker Hughes Working with the Service Delivery Coordinator/Salesman to ensure any risk of meeting the client's objective is communicated to the client using the appropriate channels/processes for the respective client Accurately documenting any calculations/simulations/plan revision and/or changes during the project cycles for visibility to dependent teams and audit purposes Providing on-demand support in accordance with product portfolio or on-call schedule for job execution Comparing job as-planned versus job as-executed and document any lessons learned to ensure opportunity for continuous improvement Working on Field Incidents related to products/services Participating in Incident Investigation when required, ensuring end to end process, from job planning, preparation, and execution is considered to determine the incident root cause and drive appropriate corrective actions Ensuring timely incident management to enable fast customer issue resolution and cash collection Advising on product improvement opportunities for repetitive component/product failures Responsible for providing sales support and product application recommendations Product line specific responsibilities as applicable  Fuel your passion  To be successful in this role you will:  Bachelor's degree in engineering Minimum 3+ years of relevant work experience Excellent leadership, strong interpersonal, influencing and planning skills Ability to manage, develop, coach and mentor teams across organizational boundaries Ability to be on call outside of normal business hours Demonstrated ability to work in a global matrix organization Thorough understanding of P/L and technical job planning requirements Excellent communication and presentation skills Strong organizational, analytical and problem solving skills Must have the ability to travel (typically travel to rig sites, customer facilities, meetings, etc.) Significant operational experience Comfortable presenting in front of an audience of experienced peers Rig site drilling optimization experience is a definite plus Ability to learn and use various computer tools to prepare data and visualizations for analysis Ability to work independently  Working with us  Our people are at the heart of what we do at Baker Hughes. We know we are better when all of our people are developed, engaged and able to bring their whole authentic selves to work. We invest in the health and well-being of our workforce, train and reward talent and develop leaders at all levels to bring out the best in each other.  The Good Stuff  Our inventions have revolutionized energy for over a century. But to keep going forward tomorrow, we know we have to push the boundaries today. We prioritize rewarding those who embrace change with a package that reflects how much we value their input. Join us, and you can expect:  Contemporary work-life balance policies and wellbeing activities Comprehensive private medical care options Safety net of life insurance and disability programs Tailored financial programs Additional elected or voluntary benefits  About Us  With operations in over 120 countries, we provide better solutions for our customers and richer opportunities for our people. As a leading partner to the energy industry, we’re committed to achieving net-zero carbon emissions by 2050 and we’re always looking for the right people to help us get there. People who are as passionate as we are about making energy safer, cleaner and more efficient.  Join Us  Are you seeking an opportunity to make a real difference in a company with a global reach and exciting services and clients? Come join us and grow with a team of people who will energize and inspire you!  About Us:  With operations in over 120 countries, we provide better solutions for our customers and richer opportunities for our people. As a leading partner to the energy industry, we’re committed to achieving net-zero carbon emissions by 2050 and we’re always looking for the right people to help us get there. People who are as passionate as we are about making energy safer, cleaner and more efficient.  Join Us:  Are you seeking an opportunity to make a real difference in a company that values innovation and progress? Join us and become part of a team of people who will challenge and inspire you! Let’s come together and take energy forward.  Baker Hughes Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.  R18118

description: Обязанности: Увеличение продаж оборудования HVAC Джонсон Контролс, увеличение доли рынка, повышение прибыли компании. Поиск новых заказчиков, сотрудничество с существующими заказчиками, консультантами, проектными и другими организациями. Подготовка совместно с инженером по технической поддержки и проектировщиком технико-коммерческих предложений, представление их заказчикам. Подготовка совместно с инженером по технической поддержке договоров и карт заказов. Поддержание обновленной информации по оборудованию и ассортименту предлагаемой продукции компании. Участие в организации и работе выставок, презентаций. Своевременное составление и предоставление планов и отчётов Требования: Высшее техническое образование (вентиляция, кондиционирование, холодоснабжение). Опыт работы на аналогичной должности от 1 года обязателен. Английский язык на разговорном уровне (intermediate). Продвинутый пользователь ПК. Отсутствие ограничений по командировкам по стране и за границу. Условия: Оформление по ТК РФ. Заработная плата и бонусный план обсуждается с наиболее успешным кандидатом. Комиссия от продаж в соответствии с бонусной политикой компании. Корпоративная мобильная связь. Добровольное медицинское страхование и страхование жизни (после испытательного срока). description: Want to be part of something really exciting? We’re on a mission to change the way health and care is delivered. Working closely with our customers, we are leading the way in the delivery of patient centred, connected, digitally enabled health and care services.  Our customers and partners are using our market-leading solutions in all Health and Care settings, from GP surgeries and community care to high street pharmacies, hospitals, clinics, not for profit organisations and specialist services. We are committed to developing the next generation of healthcare technology that will realise the vision of truly joined up healthcare.  Our Product Management team delivers end to end lifecycle management across our group product portfolio. We’re obsessed with building world class products from that address the needs of our customers and partners. We’re building a super star team to deliver on our mission and we’re well on the journey. We strive to create an environment where you can do your best work. At EMIS, you’ll be challenged and supported in equal measure. Ours is a culture of integrity and trust and our people are empowered to make decisions that ensure success at pace.  Product Manager - Platform  As a Product Manager Platform you will be responsible for the entire product lifecycle; developing and managing products and services from market and customer insights to underpin business growth. You will be a strong collaborator, with proven experience of working with Development, Sales & Operational teams to ensure that we build exciting market propositions with profitable products that surprise and delight our customers.  You will work closely with commercial colleagues to understand the current and future needs of customers and drive forward our propositions.  You’ll be responsible for, ensuring requirements are developed and shaped in line with the company’s strategic direction as well as customer and market demands. This is a fantastic opportunity for a product management professional to marry their technical, creative and problem solving skills to produce an innovative and commercially successful product to delight our customers and make a real difference to healthcare in the UK.  As The Product Manager - Platform You Will Be Accountable For The End-to-end Product Lifecycle Management For Products And Portfolios Of Responsibility  Gather market research & customer feedback and perform analysis. Acquire data and knowledge about the market and competitors and pro-actively engage with customers, sales, support and other channels to understand opportunities and challenges to inform your product vision, strategy and plan.  Product development. Develop differentiated value propositions that address market needs, and from robust requirements definition, work with product owners and development/partner teams to ensure timely, quality product delivery in line with commercial and operational product plan objectives.  Ensure Product Performance. Manage in-life performance to ensure commercial and operational success through the evolution of the product, making prioritisation calls to balance roadmap and opportunity-led demands.  Proactive engagement and communications with external and internal stakeholders to establish yourself as the focal point for your product, both evangelising to the market and our sales teams and ensuring our operational teams have what they need to ensure excellent product and service delivery.  Own and maintain of all product artefacts; plans, roadmaps, guides etc. - working with Product Marketing on go to market messaging and launch activities.  Market-facing and commercially astute, build compelling Product Plans that you can successfully manage through the entire product lifecycle and be comfortable presenting to C-Level.  Be an exceptional collaborator and communicator, demonstrating thought leadership in your domain and be recognised for doing so through market events and customer networks.  Bring industry expertise and leadership and thrive in being an active contributor and influencer in the continual improvement of the product function.  What you’ll bring  A passion for, and track record of, creating high quality products and services  A wealth of experience in product management - software product management experience would be beneficial  A proven track record of delivering a commercially successful roadmap  Knowledge and awareness of NHS structure and future changes would be advantageous  Strong commercial acumen and financial analysis capabilities  Excellent influencing and communication skills at all levels, with a passion for engaging directly with our customers  Strong research capabilities and the ability to apply a balanced perspective.  Experience of scaled agile, or enterprise working  What we'll give you  In return you’ll receive a competitive salary and practical things like 25 days holiday, a competitive pension, lifestyle savings and a healthcare cash plan, so whenever the time comes and you need some help with your health, we’ll make sure you’re not out of pocket and life assurance to give you some peace of mind.  Next steps  We want to get to know you! Should you be shortlisted for the role you will receive a short video interview consisting of 3 or 4 questions which have been designed by the hiring manager. These will be reviewed alongside your CV and if successful at this stage you will be invited to a Microsoft Teams interview.  So if this snapshot of the role looks interesting, click apply. If you don’t apply now, the job may vanish, but don’t panic; sign up for our job alerts and we’ll keep you updated.  Please note EMIS has now transitioned to being a predominantly homeworking business, however you must be prepared to travel to our collaboration hubs as required.
industries: Civic & Social Organization and Nonprofit Organization Management

description: Hooray! This project is about Magenta View - a new integrated tile-based frontend overlaying our legacy CRM systems for fixed net and mobile customers, supporting the customer dialog in sales and service by supplying all relevant customer information to our customer care and shop agents and allowing them to better understand the needs of our customers.  What are the responsibilities?  • Taking part in the development of the frontend part of the project in a team of frontend- and backend developers, testers, analysts • Taking part in scrum meetings (plannings, review, retro) • User stories estimation • Direct communication with product owner (to clarify requirements).  Skillz: • Vue.js version 2 or 3 (Angular will be a plus) and TypeScript. • Knowledge State management systems experience (Redux, Flux). • Unit-test frameworks (Jest, Jasmine, Mocha). • NodeJS will be a plus. • Experience with Gitlab/Github/Bitbucket/etc. • Containerization understanding (Docker, Kubernetes), CI/CD.  Write me down for the additional questions and of course if you would like to look through other our projects and positions (800+) :D

Russia - Moscow  Collaboration drives Nordson’s success as a market leader in Industrial Precision Solutions and Advanced Technology. Our employees thrive in an environment where we help each other reach our personal best and enable our company to continuously improve and grow, and our customers to succeed. You will find Nordson employees sharing our success by giving back in the communities around the world where we live and work.  Nordson Adhesive Dispensing Systems (ADS) sets the global standard in hot melt machines and dispensing, coating, and laminating systems. Manufacturers rely on our equipment for packaging, product assembly and surface treatment applications. With a leading services and support network, we help our customers worldwide increase manufacturing efficiencies and produce the highest quality products.  Main Tasks And Responsibilities Keep in touch with Customers, including face-to-face meetings, phone calls, emails, and invitations to exhibitions. Creating a work plan for repair and maintenance of Nordson equipment in the region Have a conversations with Customer for going to systematic maintenance Prepare the solutions to improve theNordson equipment which installed by the customer Prepare the commercial quotations for the customer (new equipment, repair, service, installation, spare parts) Planning and doing audits and diagnostics of Nordson equipment Planning and doing operational repairs and maintenance of Nordson equipment Planning and doinginstallations and commissioning of new Nordson equipment; Prepare reports of work with recommendations and a list of required spare parts; Training of the customer's engineers to work with the equipment Customer support for remote operation of equipment Ordering, receiving, storing, and controlling inventory items Preferred Knowledge And Skills Higher technical education Knowledge of Nordson equipment Have a experience on production line Basic knowledge in: pneumatics, hydraulics Ability to work with electric tools Driver license "B" Confident computer skills (Outlook, Word, XL, PowerPoint) Business trips about 80% of work time Ready for long crossings by car (up to 700km) Pre-Intermediate English Posted 3 Days Ago Full time REQ26316  Whatever you do today, Nordson Corporation is likely a part of it. We engineer, manufacture and market differentiated products and systems used for precision dispensing and processing in a variety of end markets, from packaging to transportation and medical to electronics. Founded in 1954, we operate under the values of integrity, respect for people, customer passion, energy and excellence. Nordson is headquartered in Westlake, Ohio, and has direct operations in more than 30 countries to support our products and systems with application expertise and a direct global sales and service organization.
industries: Electrical/Electronic Manufacturing, Medical Devices, and Mechanical or Industrial Engineering

description: Please Note: If you are a current Spin Master employee with access to Workday, apply to this job via the Workday application.  Are you a kid at heart looking to build a career with a leading global children's toy, entertainment and digital gaming company?  At Spin Master, our unwavering commitment to open mindedness, integrity and innovation is a great part of what has made us an industry leader. How do we stay ahead of the pack? By hiring the best and brightest minds—and that’s why we want you!  Job Description  What will you work on?  You will be assisting in ensuring that tax & currency reporting is accurate and timely for Spin Master Rus.  You will be a key contributor to the monthly and annual tax accounting local.  How will you create impact? Preparation of CIT returnes and other taxes with regard to LE in RUSSIA Preparation of VAT purchase / sales ledger and VAT tax return Reconcilation of tax payments with tax authorities Posting of taxes to GL and organize payments Preparation of defer tax calculation Preparation of answers on tax authorities requests Preparation of Notification in accordance with Transfer Pricing (TP) law; participation in TP analysis and documents preparation Review of venders / customers ,agreements /invoices in order to check Russian tax risks and make sure correct reflection in accounting Communicate with internal audit team and tax authorities Automation of accounting and reporting; Currency control reporting Inform other departments/offices about recent tax legislation changes. Assist other departments on the Russian tax related issues; How will you fit into the team? Ability to work independently, being highly self-motivated Strong organizational skills Ability to work in a fast paced environment; Goal oriented to achieve targets through self-motivation, persistence & determination What are your skills and experience? Good level of knowledge in Russian taxes; Experience of a tax consultant/accountant. Good level of knowledge of Russian accounting standards; Microsoft Excel , skills are required; An understanding of technical accounting such as IFRS, GAAP and consolidations in a multi-currency environment as well as experience of financial reporting; Experience working with SAP Tax Accountant with minimum 3-5 years of relevant experience preferably in the FMCG industry. Fluency in English is a must; What’s it like to work here?  Spin Master is a fast-paced, hands-on organization that provides many great opportunities for impactful decision-making; though our challenging start-up atmosphere isn’t for everyone, we have a proven record of opportunities for future advancement and internal transfers for our passionate and results driven team.  What You Can Expect From Us  Our mission is to Make Life More Fun with a vision to push the boundaries of innovation, creativity, and fun. From top leadership to new and veteran team members alike, everyone at Spin Master embodies our Core Values: We partner We invent We are open-minded We collaborate We get results We’ve got integrity We are entrepreneurs Follow us on Instagram and Twitter @SpinMaster to stay up to date on Spin Master career opportunities.  We do appreciate all interest; however only those selected for interview will be contacted.
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Consumer Goods, and Retail

description: The Technical Product Manager for MongoDB is responsible for the inbound and outbound product management efforts involving our MongoDB software. Working closely with engineering teams, the goal is to further product adoption and growth. You will collaborate with customers, partners, other product managers and tech leads at Percona, translating the product vision into user stories and use-cases that engineering can feasibly implement. You will balance time and scope to ensure that we are delivering value to the user.  What You Will Do Establish the product strategy as it complements corporate and product vision and translate into easy to consume roadmaps to bring a product to life Identify product and market opportunities through customer, community, and stakeholder interactions, e.g., conducting surveys or contacting existing customers directly to understand exactly what they are looking for Collaborate with other Technical Product Managers to ensure alignment of our tactical plans with the strategic vision, providing complimentary product support in a timely manner Own relationship with technology partners: work with development partners on feature requirements, drive ad-hoc features for specific customer cases and be responsible for product capabilities and functionality Build and own relationship to Architecture and Engineering: Work with the development team(s) to come up with time estimates for work to be done, dependencies, and difficulty of work Support the Engineering teams with creating schedules, associated planning documents, create/maintain epics/stories, and/or requirements documents Own product release planning/delivery, plan and drive public beta test programs, monitor critical bugs. Coordinate product releases with global services, marketing, and sales Explore new ways of improving our existing services and products Provide product training and technical expertise Your Experience 2+ years of experience with databases and related technologies 4+ years of product management or software development management experience with enterprise IT software (experience with open source and databases a plus) Demonstrate a good understanding of customers’ business challenges and needs Team player - ability to work both within the product team and across other teams Excellent work ethic, self-motivated and self-managed, strong organizational skills & ability to meet deadlinу Willing to travel occasionally on business (as travel conditions permit) Language skills: English fluently, additional languages appreciated Very good verbal, written, and presentation skills, including public speaking skills Experience in working with inter-departmental stakeholders to successfully develop and deliver software products and solutions Ability to lead without requiring authority to be given first, breaking down barriers between product areas and functions What Will Make You Stand Out Experience working with Open Source Communities and various open source projects Having a track record of being an active member of the MongoDB community or other open source database communities Percona is a respected thought leader in the open source community. We provide services and software for MySQL, MongoDB, PostgreSQL and MariaDB to open source users globally.  Percona is remote-first and globally dispersed; we have colleagues in more than 40 countries! We offer a collaborative, highly-engaged culture where your ideas are welcome and your voice is heard. The growth and development of our staff is a top priority; we provide funding for training, certifications, conferences and more.  Discover what it means to work with some of the smartest people in the industry, who also know how to have fun and are always willing to lend a helping hand. We offer flexible hours, the ability to work remotely and the amazing experience of working with a multinational team of experts.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet

description: Weatherford is the leading wellbore and production solutions company. Operating in more than 80 countries, the Company answers the challenges of the energy industry with its global talent network of approximately 20,000 team members and 600 locations, which include service, research and development, training, and manufacturing facilities. Visit weatherford.com for more information or connect on LinkedIn, Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, or YouTube.  We’re looking to the future with a clear vision and a strong mission.  Our goal is to address the headwinds facing the industry, revolutionize the oilfield with digital technology, integrated solutions, and world-class talent.  We accept every challenge for the benefit of our Company, our industry, and the world. Our technology leadership delivers solutions that rise to every occasion, supply the best outcomes in each operation, and give power to all customers.  Weatherford offers competitive compensation, a comprehensive benefits program and opportunities for on-going training and career development. VEVRAA Federal Contractor - Priority Referral Requested.  Weatherford is an Equal Opportunity Employer Females/ Minorities/ Veterans/Disabled and gives consideration for employment to qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.  Our Asset and Inventory Coordinator is responsible for maintaining records of assets and materials in inventory and order. Day to day you will be providing information to determine the status of current orders and to forecast needs for future orders. You will compile documentation of materials and stock on hand, monitor reorder points and initiate action to replenish stock as needed.  Responsibilities And Duties Reconciles discrepancies in inventories and notifies supervisor of irregularities and when stock reaches designated reorder point. Compiles information on receipt or disbursement of inventories and computer inventory balances, crisis, and cost. Stock and issue materials and merchandise. Ensure inventory accuracy through conducting all inventory transactions related to shipping, receiving, work orders and sales orders accurately and in a timely manner. Decompose and reclassify assets in an accurate and timely manner. Conduct all transactions related to parent/child asset relationships accurately and in a timely manner. Maintain, track and forecast inventory on an ongoing basis. Run and initiate cycle count reports on a daily basis. Provide variance explanation, if needed. Know and understand Weatherford Quality Policy and comply with all requirements of the Quality Systems Manual, Operating and Technical Procedures and Workplace Instructions. Must understand and comply with all safety rules and company policies of Weatherford. � Work assignments carried out to the highest quality level. Perform various other duties and activities as assigned by supervisor within the physical constraints of the job. Technical Educcation or equivalent Experience workingina Warehouse Workingknowledge with Loading, unloading equipment Previous expereince with Inventory (3 years) Previous experience with booking goods in/out Ideally expereince in 1C Experience with driving a Forklift Ability to multi-task Proficient in basic computer skills Strong oral and written communication skills Excellent organizational skills
industries: Information Technology and Services, Oil & Energy, and Human Resources

description: Sealed Air is in business to protect, to solve critical packaging challenges and to leave our world better than we found it. Our portfolio of leading packaging solutions includes CRYOVAC® brand food packaging, SEALED AIR® brand protective packaging and BUBBLE WRAP® brand packaging, which collectively enable a safer, more efficient food supply chain and protect valuable goods shipped around the world. Sealed Air generated $4.9 billion in sales in 2020 and has approximately 16,500 employees who serve customers in 115 countries. To learn more, visit www.sealedair.com.  Job Description  Reports to: Service & Application Manager  Develops, tests and introduces new applications, products, processes and systems to customers to ensure optimum use of the Company's product offerings and achieve the Business Units' growth objectives.  Job Responsibilities In coordination with Sales and Marketing, supports customers in the implementation of new products and systems. Plans, organizes, performs and coordinates lab and field testing, collaborating on testing methods and procedures. Evaluates all aspects of product and system performance in consideration of customer requirements and specifications (e.g., ease with which materials are handled, interaction with machinery, production rates). Documents, generates reports on and analyzes testing, product and system performance data. Troubleshoots issues, monitors, and makes recommendations to optimize product and system performance. Ensures all activities are in compliance with Company, regional, and customer standards, policies and procedures and Safety Rules. Coordinates activities with Sales and Marketing for a coherent approach to customers. Provides input to Sales proposals. Acts as Application Leader with Sales and Marketing team in the preparation of Technical Requests for new products and systems. Maintains open communication to ensure all information involving testing and customer activities is communicated. Manages specific projects as Team Leader or Team Member, ensuring timely progress and interface with colleagues. Develops new applications for existing products through knowledge of market needs and cross-fertilization with other Company functions or external institutions. Helps generate ideas for new products and systems in order to keep the Company at the forefront of specialist packaging technology. Provides product and system training to Sales force and customers. Implements training and quality audit programs. Follows and recommends improvements for Safety and Hygience Company guidelines in-house, at Packforum, and at customer sites. Requirements Degree in Engineering 3-5 years relevant work experience Upper Intermediate English Requisition id: 35082  Relocation: No  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or protected veteran status.  LINK1 MON1
industries: Electrical/Electronic Manufacturing, Mechanical or Industrial Engineering, and Consumer Goods

jobTitle: Applications Design Engineer - Europe and Africa
description: Position Description  At a Glance  Legrand has an exciting opportunity for an Applications Design Engineer – Europe & Africa to join the Starline Team in Europe. The Applications Engineer provides high-level engineering expertise, technical design and commercial support on the application of Starline high amperage busduct products to specific projects and customers; you will have the task of overseeing the activities aimed at defining and consequently drafting the offers for the products; also responsible for identifying and providing reliable solutions for all technical issues to assure complete customer satisfaction through all stages of the project; establishes and maintains strong relationships throughout the project cycle  What Will You Do? Maintain High-level expertise of product knowledge and application Complete System Layouts; design layouts of busduct systems based on site surveys, customer drawings, project tenders and field input Utilise AutoDesk Suite to assess and understand customer requirements Use AutoCAD, Revit, Inventor & BIM360 Create technical product documentation (catalog sheets, FAQ’s, Tech Briefs, Reports, instructions, etc.) Provide technical and commercial support to sales and to customers onsite or remotely as required on topics including product estimation, RFQ support, ratings, compliance with local regulations and Standards, safety, functionality, customization, troubleshooting and pricing Attend customer facing meetings which may include providing customer presentations for product solutions and project updates Draft offers related to busduct products Verify the technical aspects of the application (based on the technical needs expressed by the customer and drawings of the installation layout) Verify the technical characteristics (operating temperature, power, installation, material, quantity, etc.) Support the management of the customer’s project through the entire project cycle Work with internal departments including Purchasing, Research and Development, Testing, Product Engineering, 3 rd party assembly providers (for assembly designs) Resolve customer technical design issues Onsite troubleshooting and rework Act as technical liaison to the sales team Train on busduct products and design tools to Sales network Provide assistance to Service Group through helping to project manage installations Requirements  Qualifications BS degree in Electrical Engineering or Mechanical Engineering 3+ years of experience in the Electrical Engineering or Mechanical Engineering field Proficiency with Microsoft Office Familiarity with project management tools such as Prince2 Proficiency in technical writing and communication Prior experience with Busduct products is preferred Ability to travel up to 15% on a regular basis and 20% occasionally, mainly in EMEA, and other locations as required Willing and able to use personal protective equipment including safety glasses and hearing protection Ability to differentiate between colors Aptitude for electrical product design and application in power distribution and busduct products Experienced user of AutoDESK programs – AutoCAD, Revit, Inventor Experience using BIM360 Familiarity with the IEC standards and various IEC certifications Persuasive and articulate, with an ability to communicate and influence people at all levels, orally, in writing and by presentation Stable, loyal and reliable, with a customer focused personality Self-reliant, flexible and resourceful Company Info  About Legrand  Every single day, Legrand brings power, light and data to millions of spaces around the world. Legrand is a global, publicly-traded company listed on the Euronext ( Legrand SA EPA: LR ) with 36,000 employees worldwide, a market cap of $16B, revenue of more than $5 billion, with products sold in 180 countries. Legrand is listed on the Forbes Global 2000 as one of the world’s best employers. For more information, visit legrand.com .  About Legrand North And Central America  Legrand North and Central America (LNCA) employs over 5,000 associates in 60 locations, working in 6 product categories (Electrical Wiring Systems, Building Control Systems, AV, Data Communications, Data, Power and Control, and Lighting). LNCA offers comprehensive medical, dental and vision coverage. LNCA offers distinctive benefits like high employer 401(k) match, above-benchmark paid maternity leave, paid time off to volunteer, and an active women’s network. LNCA is an employee-centered, growth company with tremendous opportunity. For more information, visit legrand.us.  About Legrand’s Data Center Power And Control Division  Legrand’s Data, Power & Control (DPC) division is a global provider of award-winning technology and infrastructure products which serve the expanding requirements of today’s data centers and related ecosystems. Our innovative products are principally sold under the Starline, Raritan, Server Technology, US Safety Trolley, and Legrand brand names. As a leading provider of best-in-class overhead power supply systems, intelligent PDUs, KVM switches, connectivity, cabinet and containment solutions, our goal is to support next generation technologies with flexibility for future growth and energy and installation efficiencies, united by superior design. For more information, visit starlinepower.com , raritan.com and servertech.com  http://www.legrand.us  http://www.youtube.com/legrandna  http://www.linkedin.com/company/44580  http://twitter.com/legrandNA  Equal Opportunity Employer
industries: Electrical/Electronic Manufacturing, Construction, and Information Technology and Services

description: На эту позицию мы рассматриваем резюме от кандидатов из любого города. Возможен формат удаленной работы или из любого нашего офиса (Москва, Санкт-Петербург, Томск).  Мы международная IT-компания Sibedge, специализирующаяся на разработке программного обеспечения: web-разработка и мобильные приложения. Компании более 10 лет. Офисы в части production расположены в Москве, Санкт-Петербурге, Сибири, в части Sales and Marketing - в Сан-Франциско и Австралии. Штат насчитывает более 140 специалистов. За нашими плечами более 350 счастливых клиентов, которым мы помогли достичь лучших результатов в бизнесе - https://sibedge.com/clients/. Наш фокус в части разрабатываемых продуктов: FinTech, High Availability services, Medicine, LMS, Security. Мы постоянно развиваемся и стремимся стать лучшими в нашей индустрии!  Сейчас мы находимся в поиске .NET разработчика, который имеет опыт работы на C# (.Net Core) более двух лет, отлично знаком с Microsoft SQL Server, а сейчас ищет новые проектные вызовы для себя.  📌Чем вам предстоит заниматься:  ✔Развивать платформу интернет-банкинга одного из Банков первого эшелона, включающего в себя широкий спектр возможностей современного ДБО; ✔Создавать новый функционал клиентского сайта Банка; ✔Работать в большой команде профессионалов; ✔Выдавать качественный результат в обозначенные сроки ✔Работать в современном стеке технологий (микросервисы, Docker, RabbitMQ, Redis и т.д.).  📌Мы бы хотели, чтобы кандидат имел следующий опыт и качества:  ✔Опыт коммерческой разработки более 3 лет; ✔Уверенное владение C#, платформа .NET 4+/Core 3+; ✔Опыт работы с ASP .Net Core; ✔Опыт работы с любой современной ORM: EF Core, Linq2DB; ✔MS SQL/ PostgreSQL на уровне написания эффективных хранимых процедур/функций, понимание транзакционной логики, опыт анализа планов выполнения и оптимизации запросов; ✔Глубокое понимание N-Layer архитектуры, IoC, LINQ; ✔Понимание принципов SOLID.  📌Мы дополнительно отметим:  ✔Опыт работы в проектах по методологии Agile/Scrum; ✔Опыт разработки высоконагруженных систем; ✔Опыт кластеризации с RabbitMQ, Redis; ✔Опыт работы с оркестрацией и кластеризацией: Docker/Kubernetes; ✔Знание паттернов, DDD; ✔Владение английским языком на уровне А2 и выше.  📌Условия у нас ─ это:  ✔У нас три офиса, отсюда и распределенная команда, но каждый сотрудник работает в своей тайм-зоне. Свой рабочий день вы можете начать в гибком режиме; ✔Официальное трудоустройство (Больничные, отпускные); ✔Подключение ДМС со стоматологией; ✔Постоянное профессиональное развитие: Корпоративное обучение английскому языку. Регулярная практика проведения внутренних воркшопов по инициативе сотрудников на профессиональные темы. Возможность очного участия в конференциях в качестве слушателя или спикера. ✔У нас понятная горизонтальная структура, отсюда отсутствие бюрократии, микроменеджмента и дресс-кода; ✔Мы поддерживаем work–life balance: помимо работы у нас яркие корпоративные мероприятия; ✔Реферальная программа: мы уверены, что лучшие сотрудники приходят к нам по рекомендации тех, кто уже с нами.  До встречи в Sibedge!

jobTitle: Storage and Compute Solutions FAE / ESE
location: St Petersburg, St Petersburg City, Russia
description: Company Description  Microchip Technology Inc. is a leading provider of embedded control applications. Our product portfolio comprises general purpose and specialized 8-bit, 16-bit, and 32-bit microcontrollers, 32-bit microprocessors, field-programmable gate array (FPGA) products, a broad spectrum of high-performance linear, mixed-signal, power management, thermal management, radio frequency (RF), timing, safety, security, wired connectivity and wireless connectivity devices, as well as serial Electrically Erasable Programmable Read Only Memory (EEPROM), Serial Flash memories, Parallel Flash memories, and serial Static Random Access Memory (SRAM). We also license Flash-IP solutions that are incorporated in a broad range of products.  Job Description  Embedded Solutions Engineer / Field Application Engineer  EMEA Compute & Storage Market Segment  Location: Russia (Moscow or St Petersburg)  What will you do in this position?  Microchip is a global market leader in both components and complete systems for server storage through the Adaptec® branded RAID cards, frequency and time synchronisation, power-over-ethernet mid-spans and switches. Reporting to the Senior Regional Channel Manager of our CIS EMEA group (Communications, Infrastructure and Services), you will be part of Microchip’s European sales and field applications team responsible for the systems business across EMEA.  What’s attractive about this opportunity?  As Embedded Solutions Engineer (ESE; Microchip’s term for Field Application Engineer) you will play a key role in supporting and achieving the customer support and growth objectives for the EMEA region. This role, focussing primarily on the Russian speaking territories, will have deep engagement with our Channel and Ecosystem partners, System Integrators, and end users. This position will expose you to various business units within the company globally (especially those manufacturing complete systems) and will allow you to get extremely involved with strategic and focus customers, Microchip sales, application engineering teams as well as channel partners throughout the EMEA region.  More details on the expectations and responsibilities in this position: Become a trusted advisor to strategic clients in your territory focusing primarily on data storage and data center architectures and systems; with emphasis on pre and post sales field technical support of Microchip’s Adaptec Storage Solutions ( https://www.microchip.com/en-us/products/storage ) Work closely with regional sales and account managers to develop account strategies to win key opportunities and achieve sales objectives. Grow revenue and increase relationship management within these clients through all sales and fulfilment channels Establish and maintain strong working relationships with internal Engineering teams Proactively establish strong technical relationships within assigned account base Provide ongoing technical/on-site support to assigned accounts as required Product debug in customer lab including system hardware, firmware, and software Identify customer architectures, product features, specifications, etc. and provide crisp feedback to the Product Marketing team Provide technical training as required for customers, distributors, Channel partners, etc. Contribute to Microchips knowledge base resources; e.g. application notes, technical presentations, etc. Participating in conferences and delivering industry presentations Job Requirements  Qualifications And Experience Electronic or Electrical Engineering, Telecommunication or Information Technology Degree (or equivalent). Ideally >7 years of experience in B2B sales as well as a track record of large account management Solid experience in data, server, storage and/or telecom network architectures Competency Solid working knowledge of Server, Storage and Data Centre infrastructure, Information/Communication Technology concerning network architectures, I.T. Infrastructure and Security; Timing, Synchronization. Strong project management and problem-solving skills are highly recommended Skilled communication and teamwork ability is key Highly proficient in Microsoft Office (especially Excel and PowerPoint); ModelN and SalesForce CRM experience an advantage Fluent in Russian and English
industries: Electrical/Electronic Manufacturing and Semiconductors

description: Are you a Software Engineer looking for an interesting project to work on?  Are you passionate about being part of a successful team?  Join our OFS Team  Our Oilfield Services (OFS) business provides intelligent connected technologies to monitor and control our energy extraction assets. Our Sales team work in partnership with our business partners to build loyalty and develop sales growth. We take responsibility for the business' success by building trusted relationships and understanding our partners.  Partner with the best  As a Software Engineer, you will be responsible for programming a feature set. You will use Microsoft Visual Studio, .NET, C#, Internet Technologies. We expect your knowledge of data structures, algorithms, and software engineering principles.  As a Software Engineer, you will be responsible for:  Providing direction and assistance to the workgroup in order to meet assigned objectives. Developing software and maintenance of components, systems, and their networks. Analyzing user needs to design and code. Programming (Microsoft Visual Studio, .NET, C#). Working closely with the business unit to ensure application development meets product specification requirements. Designing, implementing and testing software, ensuring quality specifications are met.  Fuel your passion  To be successful in this role you will:  Be a graduate with experience in Microsoft Visual Studio, .NET, C#. Demonstrate knowledge of data structures, algorithms, and software engineering principles. Have a good command of oral and written communication skills in English.  Work in a way that works for you  We recognize that everyone is different and that the way in which people want to work and deliver at their best is different for everyone too. In this role, we can offer the following flexible working patterns:  Working flexible hours - flexing the times you work in the day  Working with us  Our people are at the heart of what we do at Baker Hughes. We know we are better when all of our people are developed, engaged and able to bring their whole authentic selves to work. We invest in the health and well-being of our workforce, train and reward talent and develop leaders at all levels to bring out the best in each other.  Working for you  Our inventions have revolutionized energy for over a century. But to keep going forward tomorrow, we know we have to push the boundaries today. We prioritize rewarding those who embrace change with a package that reflects how much we value their input. Join us, and you can expect:  Contemporary work-life balance policies and wellbeing activities Comprehensive private medical care options Safety net of life insurance and disability programs Tailored financial programs Additional elected or voluntary benefits  About Us  With operations in over 120 countries, we provide better solutions for our customers and richer opportunities for our people. As a leading partner to the energy industry, we're committed to achieving net-zero carbon emissions by 2050 and we're always looking for the right people to help us get there. People who are as passionate as we are about making energy safer, cleaner and more efficient.  Join Us  Are you seeking an opportunity to make a real difference in a company with a global reach and exciting services and clients? Come join us and grow with a team of people who will energize and inspire you!  About Us:  With operations in over 120 countries, we provide better solutions for our customers and richer opportunities for our people. As a leading partner to the energy industry, we’re committed to achieving net-zero carbon emissions by 2050 and we’re always looking for the right people to help us get there. People who are as passionate as we are about making energy safer, cleaner and more efficient.  Join Us:  Are you seeking an opportunity to make a real difference in a company that values innovation and progress? Join us and become part of a team of people who will challenge and inspire you! Let’s come together and take energy forward.  Baker Hughes Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.  R34893
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Oil & Energy

description: All of us at EFI are relentlessly focused on just one thing: the growth and success of the print business. That’s why tens of millions of print professionals worldwide turn to EFI to fuel their success.  Our 3,000+ worldwide team members prove our commitment to you every day by developing breakthrough technologies for the manufacturing of signage, packaging, textiles, ceramic tiles, and personalized documents, with a wide range of printers, inks, digital front ends, and a comprehensive business and production workflow suite that transforms and streamlines the entire production process  EFI is looking for a Field Service Engineer in Oxford-Reading-Swindon area.  This is a hands-on role and on the field, travelling and visiting customers, supporting them with their technical issues with their digital printing machines. In order to be succesful in this role you need to like travelling and helping customers with a diverse range of issues: could be electric, mechanical, pneumatic, ink, color management. It is a diverse role, no day will be the same with the previous one. If you find it rewarding to solve issues everyday and meet our end customers and make them happy, we would love talking to you.  This position requires extensive travel in the local regional to cover:  Main Duties Onsite technical customer support for warranty, contract and non-contract customers The installation and documenting of ink changeovers, printer upgrades and modifications as directed by Service Management and Service Engineering. The de-installation, Installation and the moving of customer printers. Tradeshow support including printer set up and calibration, demonstration and tear down. End user operator training for specific printer models. Feedback to our US based R&D and engineering teams on printer operation in the field. Be an ambassador for EFI and be r responsible for maintaining a positive relationship with customer. Other Duties Responsible for the timely and accurate completion of Service Reports, Time Tracking, Site Visit Reports, Expense Reports and other business-related documents. Feedback to sales via the service team any opportunities to improve customer satisfaction and increase EFI business opportunities. Feedback to service engineering improvements related to EFI printer documentation and manuals. Other reasonable duties as required by EFI. Knowledge & Key Skills  Job Requirements Knowledge of printing systems and or similar equipment. Ability to work independently with minimum back-up when necessary. Good knowledge in mechanical and electrical skills. Essential Qualifications/Education Relevant technical apprenticeship or technical qualification or degree in electrical / instrumentation / mechanical / process disciplines preferred. Essential Previous Experience Up to 3 years post qualification experience in a service or similar position servicing complex electro-mechanical devices. Important To Know Must be prepared to work unsociable hours when required eg, overtime, weekend. Current driving licence. Passport holder. Ability to travel at short notice – home country and abroad on occasion. Work well alone or as part of a team. Computer literate including email, office applications and general Windows features. Share
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Information Technology and Services, and Computer Software

description: Could you make a difference to those who are vulnerable?  Care in the community is more important than ever before! At Bluebird Care, we ensure the safety and wellbeing of the elderly and vulnerable in the comfort of their homes as an alternative to a care home and to help free up beds across the NHS.  We have both full-time & part-time hours to suit you and even have some immediate starts available. To be eligible to apply, you must have a Full Driving Licence and access to your own reliable transport as you will be travelling in-between customers.  We pay our successful candidates for their time during our 3-day induction training. All successful candidates would receive this within their first pay.  No experience necessary, although we do welcome those with previous Care or Support Worker experience.  What We Offer Our Care Assistants  A career pathway with opportunities for promotion & development  Enhanced salary on weekends & bank holidays  Full-time & part-time hours  Flexible working hours  Temporary or permanent opportunities  Paid mileage from customer to customer  Recognition of your career milestones  Fun events for all Care Assistants  Ongoing accredited training/support  Full self-assessment training  Company pension scheme  28 days paid holiday (pro-rata)  PAID Induction training – 3 days  We understand that because of the COVID-19 pandemic, safety is more important than ever before. We place the wellbeing of our staff and customers at the forefront of all we do. That is why we provide in-Depth online training, rapid response COVID-19 tests before coming to the office, weekly COVID-19 tests and full Personal Protective Equipment (PPE).  Interested? Click Apply Now to send us your contact details and we will be in touch to discuss further.  We have recruited people who have previously worked as a Hotel Receptionist, Cleaner, Sales Assistant, Customer Service and/or Retail Assistant as they had fantastic transferable skills to become a great Healthcare Assistant.
industries: Nonprofit Organization Management, Staffing and Recruiting, and Hospital & Health Care

location: St Petersburg, St Petersburg City, Russia
description: About Toptal  Toptal is a global network of top freelance talent in business, design, and technology that enables companies to scale their teams, on-demand. With $200+ million in annual revenue and over 40% year-over-year growth, Toptal is the world’s largest fully remote company.  We take the best elements of virtual teams and combine them with a support structure that encourages innovation, social interaction, and fun. We see no borders, move at a fast pace, and are never afraid to break the mold.  Position Description  Toptal is a hypergrowth organization, which means that we are constantly onboarding new team members and working with our existing team members to build new skills. As a Senior Learning Experience Designer at Toptal, you will build a world-class Learning and Development function as part of the People team, working with leaders and individual contributors across the company to identify areas for improvement and build the learning plans and materials necessary to realize those improvements. You will create a strategy for new, high-quality training materials, build knowledge validation exercises, design engaging learning paths, and more. You will build deep institutional knowledge of the core skills needed for key positions across Toptal, thinking critically about innovative ways to elevate the abilities of team members across the organization.  This is a remote position that can be done from anywhere. Due to the remote nature of this role, we are unable to provide visa sponsorship. Resumes and communication must be submitted in English.  Responsibilities  You will work with subject matter experts across the organization to design, develop, and deliver a variety of high-quality learning solutions (e-learning, online webinars, video, and live sessions) to improve operational efficiency, drive performance, and promote leadership excellence. You will be responsible for creating effective and engaging learning interventions that impact performance, using video, voiceovers, animation, and a variety of other avenues. You will work as a part of the People team to evaluate the efficacy of our learning initiatives, build new strategies based on feedback and analysis, and evolve.  A few examples of skills for which you will be designing courses: Developing learning paths for career development and growth. Advanced technical role-specific and functional training for teams including Engineering, Product, etc. Complex leadership and manager training for all levels of leadership. In The First Week, Expect To Onboard and integrate into Toptal. Learn about Toptal services, and learn about Toptal’s organizational structure, including each team’s focus and how they interact. Begin meeting with leaders across the company. In The First Month, Expect To Work within your team to understand priorities, history, and how we work. Work with the People team and relevant team leads to understand which areas of the organization most need instructional design support. Prioritize by impact and begin working with domain experts to design learning plans and create real training materials that will be used by newcomers and existing team members. Build launch plans for your first learning modules, including effective feedback and incentive systems, and execute the launches. In The First Three Months, Expect To Adapt modules based on learner feedback to ensure they are maximally effective. Work with domain experts to build the next wave of learning modules, prioritizing by impact and focusing both on onboarding modules and skill development modules for existing team members. Build review systems to ensure that all learning and development material you create stays up-to-date over time. In The First Six Months, Expect To Create a strong base of L&D courses targeted both to onboarding newcomers and to developing the skills of existing team members, covering the major technical, cultural, soft, and procedural skills needed to be successful at Toptal. Begin to build deep relationships with domain experts across the company. In The First Year, Expect To Assist in creating an L&D framework for learning, evaluation, incentivization, retention, and adoption at Toptal that is backed by academic research and internal data, is scalable, and delivers unparalleled results. Support in scaling Learning & Development at Toptal as the organization continues to grow, ensuring our ability to develop top performers which will become a critical organizational competitive advantage. Requirements 7+ years of experience designing and developing learning programs in a fast-paced environment experiencing exponential growth. A plus if you’ve worked in a fast-paced tech start-up environment. Experience working cross-functionally with Subject Matter Experts; partnering across an international organization (Sales, Engineering, etc.) to support training needs. Advanced experience developing blended learning programs, self-directed, instructor-led training (ILT), computer based training (CBT), and webinar training. Experience with authoring tools and Learning Management Systems used to create high-quality learning materials (Lessonly, Articulate, Storyline, etc). Consult internal stakeholders on root-causes of defined performance gaps including when, where, and why training might mitigate or close the gap as well as when it will not. Work backwards from business goals and metrics as well as identified performance gaps to pinpoint root-causes of gaps and opportunities for improvement. Proven experience in creating learning metrics that are independent, holistic, accurate, encourage the right behaviors, and are aligned with company objectives. Attention to detail. Quality matters at Toptal and this must come across in all training material. Courses must be intuitive, error-free, and extremely high-quality. Creativity. You will need to use non-incremental, out-of-the-box thinking to create learning plans that are effective and scalable, while not requiring unsustainable amounts of time from learners or stakeholders. Resourcefulness. You must refuse to be impeded by anything standing in your way. You must push to get access to any resources you need, contribute unsustainable effort when the situation calls for it, and be creative in finding ways to remove blockers and deliver value. Proactive. You must be passionate about the prospect of creating a world-class learning & development discipline at Toptal and proactive in reaching out to stakeholders to define priorities and deliver on needs. You must be comfortable with ambiguity and shifting priorities, and capable of delivering value with minimal supervision. You must have excellent written and oral communication skills. You must be a world-class individual contributor to thrive at Toptal. You will not be here just to tell other people what to do. For Toptal Use Only: #west #midwest #ussouth #northeast #natechcities #uk #europe #canada #southamerica
industries: Internet
